Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus they begin to recite the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, sons, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last part of the science of medicine, by its completion one achieves perfection in it, and through its explanations and declarations, it seems to me that I have provided you with a comprehensive treatise, which is a division of the practical work, namely surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the practical work is so neglected in our region and in our time, that it has greatly suffered the decline of its science, and its practice is forgotten; and there remain none of it except for a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which were obscure and led to error and confusion, until the understanding of it was obscured and its force was weakened and the art was prolonged.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I will revive this in the ordering of this treatise, in this way: by explanation and declaration and abbreviation; and so that it comes to the forms of the preparations of cauterization and of other instruments of the work, as is necessary for the addition of the declaration, and for its preparation.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why no artisan is found with their own art in our time, is that the art of medicine is long and requires its practitioner to be exercised in the science of anatomy, which includes knowledge of the junctions of the members and the forms of those, and the connection and separation of them; and also the recognition of the bones, nerves, and cartilages, and their names, and their relation; and of the pulsating veins and the quiet ones, and the places of their origin.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And according to Hippocrates, the name of this condition is a word, more often used in minor works, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already spoken of that in the introduction to this book; for whoever is not knowledgeable about what we have said regarding anatomy, it is not surprising that they fall into error by which men die, as has been seen with many of them, because some are formed in this science and turn away from it and lack experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I have seen a foolish and inexperienced doctor having made an incision into a scrofulous aposteme on the neck of a woman, and having cut some arteries of the neck, through which a large amount of blood flowed, until the woman fell dead among her people.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who prescribed that he would swallow a stone of a man which was stuck in his throat, and the stone was large, and came out to him and extracted that stone with a piece of the bladder, through which that man on the third day died.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have already called it foolish to extract that, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, I conjectured that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who received a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and he applied to a wretched black man, who had a fracture in his thigh; and with his ignorance, the doctor extracted the fracture, on top of the wound, with poultices and splints with strong structure, and did not leave the wound to heal.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And return the disjointed according to the desires of the sick, and return the relaxed, and return the loosened by walking and commanding that we loosen the ligament; and it is necessary that this be between the thigh and the foot, so that the abscess forms, and turns into a loss.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And it is called a relief to him, and the preparation to loosen the ligament is achieved, and obtained is tranquility and thus alleviation from his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But when corruption had already established itself in the member, because it could not be restrained, and the corruption did not cease to spread in the member until the disease reached a crisis.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who made a cancerous abscess, and it was ulcerated in the same days, until the evil of it was magnified with the lord of it, the patient.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	This is because the bitter humor is pure melancholy, then it is not suitable that it should penetrate to him entirely, but rather that it should be in a member which suffers so that all of it would be evacuated.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation on the ill person be divided into two divisions: one is the operation in which health is associated, and the other is the work in which there is danger in the major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already examined this in every place of this book where an operation is described in which there is error and fear; for which it is necessary that you guard against this and avoid that, so that the foolish do not find a way to speak and accuse you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And then take your arms with solicitude and protection from God, and your patients with facility and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way by the grace of God to bring about health and praiseworthy success, and leave behind the terrible illnesses of difficult cure, and remove from your arms that which makes you afraid, so that trust in your faith and in your name does not fail you: for greater is the remainder of your glory, and afterwards in the world and lastly among your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Certainly I have spoken in some sick men's warnings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	“Do not treat the bad illness poorly, so that bad doctors are not named”.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you have already devoted this book to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first from the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter deals with the head and the feet, in the forms of instruments and in the preparations of cauteries, and with what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on dryness and perforation, and on ventoses, and on plasters, and on extraction of arrows and on similar things to those, all chaptered and ordered in the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on treatment of twists and on similar things to those; chapter ordered from head to feet, and on the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On cautery with focus and with sharp medicine and memory of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	When I describe the quality of the juices of that cautery and its outcomes, and in which condition it is prohibited to apply a cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the discourse on the quality of the juice of cautery and its outcome is a long and prolix discourse, subtle for science, and hidden secret; and already many wise men have spoken about it, and they are discordant among themselves, and for me it suffices to take a little from their discourses, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery is suitable for all universal complexion, whatever the material or non-material may be, except for two complexions, which are cold complexions without material.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the complicated and dry matter, it will be decided; for some said that a cautery is helpful for that, and others said the opposite of that, that a cautery is not convenient in an illness which is due to heat and dryness, because the nature of fire is heat and dryness, and it's convenient that a hot and dry illness with a cautious and dry treatment will be healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And they say that which says the opposite of that, that with a cautery is made a remedy for all hot and dry illnesses that occur in the bodies of men, because when you compare the body of man and its humidity to the complexity of fire, you find the body of man is cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the sermon of that one, that I have already experimented this myself many times and discovered.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But I more openly say that it is not necessary for what has already been tried and discussed in the chapter on cauteries through previous exercise, and to have understood the diversity of the complexity of men and the disposition of illnesses in their treatments, and the causes of those, and the accidents of them, and the timing of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other complications, it is not about your fear, and especially in cold and humid illnesses, because already all doctors are in agreement on those, and they do not disagree on the treatment with a cautery in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And you should know, sons, that the secret of cure by cautery with fire and the goodness of it, is that on a medical cautery, the fire is simple, whose action does not penetrate except to the member which is cauterized and does not reach another member of the body except for a small injury.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of medical fire penetrates to that in the members where it is joined, and it makes come to the member with difficulty of healing a strong help and assistance.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, by its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not make it exceed except that it is superfluous; And we have joined to us through experiment and through length of service of study in the art on the truth of causes; and for this I excuse the length of the sermon; And if it were not that it is not read in my free will in this passage, a secret hidden with fire, and the quality of its operation in bodies and of its expulsion by which you expel diseases, in a philosophical demonstrative sermon, which would be sharp in your thoughts.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, sons, that they disagree about the time in which it is convenient to do a cautery and they pause for the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is convenient at all times, because the harm caused by the accident in time is submerged in the benefit of what the cautery attracts, and especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong and frequent, which do not suffer delay for fear of those that bring malice, which is greater than small harm entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And also do not step on your feet, or, sons, that they do not esteem except the common people and foolish doctors, it is that for that illness which is healed by cautery there is not need for all time, and they pause to consider the consequences.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not known thus by them because of that, for cautery is not but in place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries the humidity which are the cause for which come the pains.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	More, I prefer cautery above medicine for the will of its validity and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the illness returns at some hour of time, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of the illness, and the virtue of it, and that which is prepared in the body from the aggregation of superfluities in it, and that which has come to it through its acquisition of food and similitudes of those causes; except that the illness in which cautery is administered is a subtle illness in a member with few superfluities and humidity, just as a cautery for a tooth for pain and similitude to that, it is possible that in it the pain does not return, but rather decreases.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And most vulgar speech is that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and it is a speech of ignorance, not because they understand it, but because they believe that it is not a cure that is improved by medicine nor by any other cause except for applying cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is to the contrary; and the intention that cautery is the last resort of medicine is only when we administer the means of cure in certain illnesses, and those medicines do not work, and then at the end of the treatment, cautery is administered, and improved by that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And it is said here that cautery is the last resort of medicine, not according to the intention which is understood by the common people and ignorant doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the sublimity of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cautery does not matter, as it is not absolutely true, because it has been proven and found that it does not work except in some bodies other than the others, and cautery with gold is good and better than with iron, as they said; but however when you do cautery with fire or with gold, it is not declared to you, because it is done according to the quantity that you want for the roughness of the gold, and prepare to receive cold; and if you adjust it on the ignited spot, the gold melts by the fire, and pour some lamellas into the fire so that the artisan can take it for the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And by this a cautery iron is made with a gentle touch and properly applied to the rectitude of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on the cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head within the feet, so that I alleviate the demanding thing that he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On the cautery for pain in the head caused by cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization is contrary to humidity and cold on the servant's accidental [condition] of which there are two causes, so it is a cause of sweat and multitude of fluxes, called rheumatism, from the head to the parts of the ears and of the hearing fluent, and multitude of sleeping, and of pain in the teeth and of the throat, and universally of all malady that comes from cold, as well as paralytic, and apoplectic, and similar things in those maladies.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is this, that first we command the patient to be evacuated with a laxative medicine for three or four nights, according to what the virtue of the malady and their age and their custom require.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and then make him sit between your hands on a wooden bench and place your hands on his chest.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then stop the flow of your palm near the foot on the flow of the nose between the two heels.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	More precisely, when the vein of the middle place is perforated, mark that place with a probe, and apply the olive cautery, which is the shape of this:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then stop that on the place you are probing with a hand that presses down, in such a way that the vein is constricted little by little, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand gently and examine the place, and if you see the bone being uncovered to some extent of the head, like the quantity of a grain of barley, then lift your hand, and if it does not return to its previous position, or if another one appears, if it is inflamed, until what has been said to you is seen by the bone.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it on the place and apply it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then stop it on the cloth wrapped in cotton and place it on until the scar of the wound is destroyed by the fire.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the place with four-part ointment until it is healthy.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it has been said that as the wound becomes larger, so much better will be the arm, because it is more improved and younger.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They said that part of it should be cauterized where the bone enters, and hold the cautery in such a way that it touches some portion of the bone's marrow.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then scrape off what is attached to the bone, and then let it heal.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	They said that others with the cautery should reach to the back, so that it presses into the bone strong pressure so that the bone breaks, and this is the method of small aphtha.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they think that from that place come out the vapors of the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And let the wound be kept open for a long time, and then be treated until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But to me, these two species of cautery have not been seen, except in some men according to the way of fear; and it seems to me, better is health, when it is; for the head is revealed by solution of continuity of the aforementioned, as we have testified in other members, and especially when the head of the patient is of frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first species of cautery is safer and better, in my opinion; and from that practice and with that work comes health.
Capitol segon.	Chapter according to.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When the head suffers from chronic and prolonged pain, and this is in the patient's prolonged illness, and uses treatments such as poultices and suppositories and head wraps and plasters and bandages and cold compresses and liniments and remedies, and especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery that has not relieved the symptoms of those causes, then consider whether the patient's head is of strong constitution in its nature; and it is not fragile and suffers from great cold, then that cautery should be done with another cautery, leaving the previous one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize that area on the horn of the sick head with a cautery until the cord is severed.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the cord and expose the bone the amount that we have described, and cauterize it with a cautery in the right part of the head, in the place which is called "vas" — and this is the place where airy flesh is found.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And lift your hand thus, and do not expose the bone, because the patient suffers from very great pain different from the pain of all the other head cauteries.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say that this cautery in its place, because it is known that the cautery with which the horns of the head and the occiput are cauterized is a more subtle cautery than the one with which the middle part of the head is cauterized; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Head of the bed.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	From the cauterization of an old migration.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When pain is located in the part of the head or it is a stabbing pain inside the eye, then evacuate the head with medicine that cleanses the head, and administer the other cure, which was previously mentioned in the treatment of illnesses; and not to prolong, there are two ways to cauterize: either cauterization with sharp burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	The most cauterizing of burning medicine is that you take a handful of salt, and scrub it and bind the extremities of the patient on both sides.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then cut into the place of pain in the temple with a sharp lancet so that it is in the patient's bad blood which remains there, until it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then apply a bandage over the wound with a tight compression, and leave it there for three hours; and then undo it and treat the salt, and leave the poultice on for two or three days, and apply a plaster submerged in hot water until the place forms a scab.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then heal it with an ointment until it is healthy.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you want, make this with some burning medicines which have been written about in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	More with the cautery iron according to this method:  warnings for the cautery of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	And it is called key or end of the hands, because its head has a form like that of a nail in which there is some curvature, and in the middle place of it is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then pause over the place of the pain, and hold your hand — so that the artery is not irritated, which is underneath — and turn the small iron little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of it that is irritated by the narrowness of the tube is as much as its size, then raise your hand so that the artery which is underneath is not irritated, so that there does not come a flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then soak a cloth in salt water and apply it to the place, and leave it there for three days; and then apply a warm poultice, and treat with an ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see it, cauterize at the extremity of the knife wound according to the cautery, and beware of the cutting of an artery in this migration properly not ancient.
Capitol quart.	Fourth chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cautery of ancient migraines.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat emigranea with the aforementioned treatment for the preceding cure, and what has been said about the divisions of illnesses, and do not hasten the cure, and sometimes due to the illness that is not enough for what has been said about the first cautery in medicine or the cautery with fire, then it is necessary that you apply the cautery iron which is albificated, because it indicates on the location of the pain along the line of longitude where the majority of the aforementioned is, or perhaps something else; and place your hand for a observation and hold it firmly while making an incision in the artery and penetrating through to the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	It is necessary for you to be mindful of the continuity of the mandible, which is harmed by chewing, and that the ligament not be injured and the nerve which gives movement to it, and that it does not become dislocated with spasms.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and caution of the flow of blood from the artery that is cut, because in the cutting of it there is fear, and especially for one who ignores what they do and is not careful and does not proceed with caution; then leave the operation to someone who begins with competence.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come to the recollection of the rule for the flow of blood from the accidental injury of the artery, according to its own method, in its own place of freedom.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this sickness does not require the cautery and you see the body of the patient tolerable, cauterize it in the middle place of the head thus as we have recounted, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you see, administer the cautery that we have spoken of in the chapter on extraction of arthritis with a cautery having two handles, and this is a better cauterization and more beneficial.
Capitol .v.	Chapter five.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cauterization of ear pains.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain from cold and it is treated with lacative causes and with the other cure that has been spoken of in the division, and the pain is not relieved, then ignite the cautery, and this is what is called a point, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And apply the point near the ignition, and let it be carried around the entire ear as if a wheel is turned, or in a circle around each part if the pain is in each part.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Bring yourself to the cautery of the root of the ear little by little until you feel the place with your finger.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery of ten points on the entire ear, and cauterize it, then treat the places until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter six.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture that is cured with cauterization is not one of the species that come from flow, as we have said in the divisions of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the species that originates from dryness or from spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure that species of torture with poultices and capers and gargling, and you do not confirm your cure, then it is known that you should cauterize the illness with three cauterizations: give one to the root of the ear, and a second a little below the temple, and the third give to the junction of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place the cauterization on the opposite side of the affected part, because mollification is only seen in the part that appears to be healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the form of cauterization is that you cauterize it with the cauter on the right side of the extremity of the ear, a little above the horn of the head, and in the temple another, the length of which should be according to the length of the aforementioned finger, and put your hand with the cauter inside until the quantity of the matter of the species of the cod is consumed.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the shape of the cautery, and it is a species of the knife, the shape of which is in front of the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	More subtle is that which takes away a little, as it seems to me; and I believe that cutting from the superfluous fatness a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the place with what is in front, processed within so that it may be healthy.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of the cautery of old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you treat it with what we have said and it does not respond to your medicine and the patient has no fever, then cauterize that with four cauteries: on all the horns of the head; and with a cautery in the middle place of the head, as we have said; and with a cautery on the nape.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the handling of the cautery is done according to what has been previously said.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it is cauterized above the mouth of the stomach; and it is more dangerous; and then it is treated with what is processed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of the cautery of oblivion caused by weakness.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	I believe that given to the patient at the beginning are bitter and great pills serving for purging.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then gently take the entire head of the patient and place it on the wooden plank described in this treatise's chapter on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And place those warm cloths, because that is the technique of cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do it according to the order which has already been stated by doctors.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And so if healing occurs with that; and if not, then make three cauteries on the back part of the head, which depend on the upper part of the head to the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the thickness of the said cloth between each cautery, and then carefully treat the cautery with what has been previously prepared.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you are experienced and the patient can tolerate it, then make the cautery in the middle place; and if your experience is greater, then apply the cautery on the two temples.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then carefully treat it until it heals; and let the olive oil cautery be according to the form previously given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cauterization of paralysis and the softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	As you proceed with the treatment of the head with earth and with what has been said; and then take the head of the patient, and then apply cautery on it in the middle place of the head, and apply cautery above all the temples of the head, and apply cautery on the back part of it, and apply three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the illness of softening of the body due to excessive moisture and the illness is strong, then cauterize that with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and strongly with a cautery until it is burned by the combustion of the codes of the same, and lift your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then return to cure that one until he is healed, and this one should be cauterized with an olive-tree cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter ten.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	It is not the epileptic who should be cauterized, but that the epilepsy is due to a flux.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore we advise that you modify the brain of the patient at the beginning with a mixture and another cure, which we have dictated in the division when the illness is great and it tolerates the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who cannot tolerate medicines, then administer gargling treatments and masticators to the servant that modifies, giving that for many days, with improvement of the food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And return to the head of the patient, and then cauterize that one with a cautery in the middle place of the head according to the preceding manner, and with another cautery on the occiput of it, and on each horn of the head let it be cauterized.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then cauterize them with the same cautery that has been mentioned, having previously softened and loosened the body on the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let the olive oil be cauterized according to what has been stated previously.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then apply a subtle cautery in this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humidity and gross weakness, then cauterize them with the same cauteries that we have mentioned in the case of paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is an overflowing inclination towards melancholy, and the body of the patient is humid, then give them a drink that cleanses their brain according to what has been stated previously in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And shave the head of the patient, and make a decently made plaster of egg on the circle, and apply it to the middle place of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be sitting upright, and let them be held firmly from all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And apply a liniment; it is also worthy to anoint the eyelids with elderberry.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	Heat that one on the fire with tempered warmth by measure, which the said sufferer feels most in it.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And apply that to the middle place of the head of it in a circle, and release it within so that it is refreshed.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	Make that to the patient for a whole week, with another regimen of it inside until it is healed; or if you wish, cauterize that making small points according to the size of it, provided you hold the hand with a cautery thus ordered: this is a type of cautery which moistens the brain with equality.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then put that cut in a poultice or in wraps of gualina.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter twelve.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of cauterization of descending water in the wheel.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When it is declared to you the beginning of water in the wheel by the signs which you have heard said in the division, then begin and give to drink to the patient that which cleanses the head of it, and keep it from all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make it sweat in a bath for ten days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command it to shave its head, and cauterize that with a cautery in the middle place of the head; and then cauterize that with two cauteries on two temples if it is the beginning of evacuation of water in two wheels, or on one side if it is the beginning of evacuation of water in one wheel.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Make incisions with a cautery on all the veins and arteries that are visible in the knee; and let the cauteries be in that length in the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And beware of flows of blood when it is being cauterized; and if you see any flow of blood, stop it with some medicine, which is within your power.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And you will come with wisdom, which is in the extraction of arteries and in the removal of those and caution of flows of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized on the neck where two bones are, with two cauteries placed backwards to produce a result.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter thirteen.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the eyes are old and assiduously flow through the veins and arteries which are in the obvious place of the head before and it is verified that this is a superfluous flow of phlegmatic humor, then cauterize it with a cautery, which we have mentioned in the chapter about the beginning of water falling into the eyes, and with a cautery in the middle place of the head and with two cauteries on the neck behind two temples, and with two cauteries on the neck behind two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	If the case requires it, then cauterize that entire area of the heel on the extremity of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of foul odor of the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat that with the remedy we have mentioned in the division and do not press your treatment, then prepare it and give to drink to the patient the decoctions for three nights; and rub the head of the patient, and cauterize it with a middle-sized cautery or an olive tree cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that area with a small nail-shaped cautery or two cauteries above the two eyebrows, leaving a small amount of hair.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And beware of the acidity that you do not inflame it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the shape of the nail-shaped cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the cauterization for softening of the eyelids of the heels.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the heel is softened by illness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery or with this lunar-shaped cautery; and this is its shape:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you do, cauterize that above the two eyebrows a little with two cauteries on the entire partition, and let them be elongated from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the quantity of the swelling.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand too much with the cautery, but rather according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid is irritated.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter sixteen.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of the cautery of the eyelid of the eye when the skin is converted to the inner parts and the eye is punctured.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the eye is converted to the inner parts so that it punctures the eye, then cautery is done in two ways, either with iron or with medicinal applications.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you apply the cautery with fire to the patient, command them beforehand that they should lift their skin like those who are about to be treated, until they are lengthened and widened; and if the needle is piercing too deeply, then tie the eyes of the patient with a bandage so that it is not moved until the skin is grown.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they are grown and widened, place the head of the patient on your thigh, and apply a sign above the eyelid of their eyes with a thread, which is shaped like a fig leaf, and let this signal be close to the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then stop putting cotton in the wound or in the poultice of pitch on the ulcer.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then apply the cautery of which this is the shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize on the figure that has been designed, little by little, in small burned spots, until the surface of the quiver is completely burnt, which appears like a fig tree leaf, clearly apparent.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	Signal of sanity of the present work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already being contracted and the skin of it being elevated due to the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and leave it there for three days, and then put on the wound a bandage until the scar is formed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that with an ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if it returns through the skin for some reason, then apply another treatment and the eyelid is softened, then do another time the cautery on that one just as you had done previously.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the skin grows on the eyelid, then cauterize it until it is elevated to its own natural place and is evened out so that the skin does not touch the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	Put the cautery in medicine to burn and this is what commands the patient to raise their skin while they are prolonged and narrowed, and then make a paper of cloth in the shape of a miter's funnel.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take soap made from congealed and living snake, or what is called aqua, and mix those things together, and make a paste to prevent it from being cold; and then spread that paste on the paper which is made in the shape of a miter's funnel, and apply that to one of the soles of the feet; and apply the heel wrapped in a poultice of warm water, and let the patient's head be in a raised position.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And then put the finger on the medicine and press it a little and not on the veins so that the patient feels the biting of the medicine, because this biting is in him like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And then when he perceives that the medicine has a biting sensation, then raise the medicine and put it on the upper finger; then when the biting stops, then remove the medicine and wash the heel with water; and then consider if the swelling is already lifted like something washed of constriction by fire or incision, because this is good; and if it does not return to that place where the medicine was applied and does not diminish until the operation is completed and the heel is contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then pause on the patient's back to ensure that the stiffness of the adjustment is eradicated, and treat that area with a soothing ointment or another entrance so that it may be healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, that you must guard your operation with vigilant diligence so that no part of the medicine falls into the eye, and if the eyelid is softened in some days and some cause of the skin pinches in the eye, then apply your medicine to that area where the eyelid is softened, and properly as it was done at the beginning, and apply a dressing to ensure that it may be healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of application of the plaster.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you should know that the eyes of men are diversified according to size and smallness, and thus your contraction is made accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And let not be hidden the way of rectitude to he who has studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cauterization of the fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with the method that we have discussed in the divisions of illnesses and do not confirm your treatment, then it is necessary that you cauterize it in this manner: command the patient to pause with their head held back, and hold the head of the patient by some servant between the hands in such a way that it may not be moved nor agitated with the head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then pause to put cotton or a poultice of warm water on the wound of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then prepare the cautery in the shape that this is:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be concave, such as the shape of a reed or a dove's wing, on one extremity where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if it happens, let it penetrate into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, let it come out like a probe.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But I prefer that which is concave to be better for the whole work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and pull out from it blood and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then apply to it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then pause on it the cautery which should be well ignited, and give to that one the whole hand except a little below the cautery from the wound to the separation of the nose, so that not the hand or the patient is disturbed, and then pause the cautery in the depth of the wound and cauterize it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And thus if at the beginning of applying the cautery you see it enter into the bone, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery one or two times, if necessary; and let it be like that for three days, and then pause on that wound with a bandage and wrap it with unguent exsiccative until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	More pain will be if it has passed eleven days and it's not healed, then pause on the medicine of sharp corrosive until the bone is uncovered and scraped according to what is convenient in the sixth chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there's another way of cauterizing a fistula, which the first doctors described: put it in the place of the fistula and make a hole and return to the narrow passage with subtlety, of which is the form of it: And put in it the quantity of one ounce of melted lead; and hold your hand with it with good retention, and do not move the patient so that the melted lead does not penetrate to the inside of that; and cover what you put on the inside of the patient with cotton soaked in white of egg or in water, because lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it by marvelous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cauterizing and of the cure, it's good; and if not, then it's necessary to administer a tube through the nose and return the fistula to the body of the nose according to how it will come into its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of the cauterization of the swelling of the feet.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times seen are ulcers in the lips, and mainly in the lips of infants.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fissures with the method that we have discussed in the divisions and do not deepen your treatment, then apply the small cutting cautery according to this form that is taught:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let the convergence of it be according to the subtlety of the cut.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then carefully place that instrument in those fissures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with wax until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cauterization of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or in the palate or in the roots of the teeth there appears an apostema, and then it is broken, and then it is antiquated, and a fistula is made, and you treat that one and do not deepen your treatment, then take care that you apply cautery according to the quantity that has been received in the fistula, and then put that applied thing in the hole of the fistula, and hold your hand so that the iron thing reaches the bottom of it, and afterwards make a dressing, one or two; and then treat it with the method that we have discussed regarding treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And thus if the blood is separated and purified, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to discover the place and remove the corrupted bone according to what is described in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of the teeth and the softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are decayed, and you treat them with medicines and not with confectons, then place the patient's head in a sling, and take a cautery in the shape of which will be described later, so that you place the swab on the tooth and introduce into it the ignited cautery, gently and slowly, and make a small hole so that the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth to be penetrated.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand, and apply the cautery repeatedly as needed.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then let the patient rinse their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and afterwards spit it out, because the decayed tooth is strengthened and the softened gum is tightened and the corrupted moisture is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When pain in the tooth is caused by cold or heat, or if the verm or worm does not respond to medical treatment, then a cautery is applied according to two methods: either a cautery with a hot iron or a cautery with a burning coal.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with a hot iron is that you take a hot iron rod and burn it in a coal fire, and then wrap the iron in cloth and apply it to the affected area, and then dip the iron in boiling water, and place it on the painful tooth, applying it gently until it becomes cold.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat this process several times until the virtue of the heat penetrates to the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, submerge a thread or cloth in the hot iron mentioned earlier, and place it on the painful tooth, and place the hot iron over it until the iron penetrates to the depth of the tooth's cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But beware of the cautery with fire that you pay attention to the size of the iron or rod, and it should be in the core of some thickness so the sharpness of the heat does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the cautery in the form that you want, and place it on the tooth and hold your hand there until the cautery becomes cold; and do this several times a day, either on that day or on the following days, until the pain is alleviated.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.
