And it is necessary that the patient should put their mouth on the good opening of the cautery and hold it for an hour and then remove it; this is the shape of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize to the extent that you can, according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the shape of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of the cauterization of excesscences or tumors.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When excesscences are of phlegm and cold humors and are not obedient to digestion by medicines and you wish to digest those lightly, then you ignite the cautery in the form of which this is the following, having two extremities covered so that the smoke of the cautery goes through the other extremity, and place that ignited thing on that apostema for a while, and another time if it is necessary for that one, until it penetrates to the bottom of the apostema.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the apostema is small, then place the cautery according to the quantity of the apostema, and remove it after three days and place on the wound a dressing in good order until what the fire has burnt is restored.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And treat that one with ointments and bandages and dressings until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	The shape of the cannula or of the cautery is such that it conveys. 
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter twenty-three.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterization of the throat and constriction of the spleen or alternatively,  Of cauterization of the region of the voice and of the constriction.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity comes into the channel of the lung, and especially when it is mixed with coldness of temperament, then it is advisable that the patient be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize the vein at the root of the throat in the affected place.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And beware that you do not touch the throat with the cautery nor burn the cartilage of it except a little.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize it with another cautery on the joint of the neck at the last vertebra of it.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And his cautery be done in the same manner as previously mentioned.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then heal it with that which has been previously stated, until it is healthy.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter twenty-four.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	Of the cauterization of sickness of the lung and of cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung sickness are from cold humidities and the patient has no fever nor wasting, and it is an old sickness, then cauterize it with two cauteries on the furcula in the affected places on the arms and shoulders; and with another cautery in the middle of the chest between the two breasts; and let the cautery be done according to the previous method.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you want, then your cauterization should be done with a cautery that is called a point, the shape of which precedes in the treatment of ear pain.

E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the matters are not removed from it, then know that it is penetrating or in the press of its rotten bone, or this comes from those causes of which a reminder will be mentioned in its place.

De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	Of the cauterization of the kidneys.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When in the kidneys a pain is caused by cold or by great swelling, and thus the cot of the patient is constricted, then it is advisable to cauterize that which is over the kidneys with a cautery on each kidney with a clave or key, from which one expects the remedy.

Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter thirty-eight.
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	On the cauterization of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When there is weakness and softening in the bladder due to cold and humidity, so that the patient cannot retain urine, then cauterize that part above the bladder, where the skin of the perineum begins, and cauterize with a cautery on the right side, and also on the left side.

E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And let the cautery be shaped like a nail according to what is needed.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter thirty-nine.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	On the cauterization of the uterus.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When cold and humidity come to the uterus, and because of this there is difficulty in conceiving, and the menses are corrupted, and their arrival is delayed, and there is pain in the abdomen, then it is necessary that the place be cauterized with three cauteries around the navel, as we have said regarding the bladder; and with a cautery above the lowest part of the back, or with two cauteries, and let the cautery be shaped like a nail.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On the cauterization of the dislocation of the ankle.

When moisture and mucus accumulate at the ankle joint, and are caused by the imbalance of its position, it is a sign that one thigh is longer than the other when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the place of the dislocation is found in which way it is bent.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then it is necessary to cauterize the patient on the ankle joint with a circular cautery, because you will have felt with your hand around the circumference of the joint, and in such a way that the joint falls into the middle of the circle.

Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cauterization of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain occurs in the ankle joint, and it is caused by cold and moisture, the patient is treated with what we have said before and it is not effective, then it is necessary to purge the patient of gross humors with foul or artificial pills or similar; and then cauterize.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	The handling of the cautery in this case is according to two methods: either with a medicinal cautery that burns, or with a cautery using fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	It will be according to two scientific methods, of which one is that it cauterizes the area on the patient's hip with three triangular cauteries in this form; and do so to a good depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And let the space that is between each cautery be the amount of the thickness of the finger, and if the olive or grain-sized cautery.

Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if it is extended into the thigh, then cauterize with two cauteries on the thigh in the place where the pain turns, and with one cautery on the hip a little below the iliac region.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery cuts, then let the depth of the cautery be according to the quantity of the inflammation of the codena.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the patient complains that the pain has spread to the area proper to the toes of the feet, then cauterize that spot with a cautery for three points or four or more if it is indicated for that.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the patient complains of pain being in the knee near the thigh, then cauterize that spot with a sharp cutting cautery.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And beware in all cauterization that you do not touch with the cautery any nerve or large artery, and that because of this there is no bad occurrence or contraction on the patient.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	I have already seen one and another of those whom I have cauterized on the hip and finished with the cauterization, and the leg became inflated within where the tumor reached the foot, and it became perforated and corrupted the whole foot.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And then comes a strong purging of the belly, and then comes death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two parts at the same time, cauterize each one according to this method.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	They say that the wise ones in cauterization of this cautery, of which this is the method: make similar to a circle of iron, of which the circumference is the size of a palm; and let it be thick according to the thickness of a finger bone or a little less.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And indent that circle another thumb; and let the space be the amount of the knot of the foot; and let those circles be divided into two parts; and let the length of those chains be a knot or two knots, and make in that margin of iron decently apparelled irons in the circles; and this is the form of it:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Then set fire to the focus within which it will ignite and emit sparks, and then place it on the affected part of the water, the patient reclining on their side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And thus cauterize that wound with three cauteries arranged in a row.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then leave it for three days; then plaster that wound with poultice and leave the open wound for many days; and then cure it with ointment until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Says Albucasis: Oh, sons, of this species of cautery we have made little use because of the fear of its management, and because we have found few who manage it properly.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	It is better for those who undergo cauteries to suffer them, and to remove them from the place where they are.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	It is better to cauterize with medicines that adhere, that you make two circles having an armula perforated in which the iron hook of the door should pass; let the length of the partitions be in the thickness of them two knots or four.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the space which is between each of the quantity of the thickness of the said thing; and let them be opened above and below, and let them contain themselves within them according to this form:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	And then stop on the part of the ill person's flank, and press your hand on the part of the flank; and take some hot water and put it between two cloths, and let the quality of that be near the small fire little by little, and apply that for the quantity of one hour, and let the patient suffer the biting and adjustment of it — because that bite is like fire — until the biting ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	And then lift your hand with the instrument and remove the hot water from the entire flank with cold water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	And then let it be for three days and apply on that wound until the blackness of the adjusted healing is removed, and let it be for several days, and cleanse his foot from the pus; this is the last treatment.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with an ointment until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain extends to the thigh or leg, make a plaster for it that contains water as is done in the aforementioned treatment.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the method of hot water, and I have already written about it in the treatise on the correction of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Recipe for alkaline and non-extinguished lime, take a portion of it, and put it in a new vessel, where the portion will be perforated by a small hole, according to the quantity that enters into the patient.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And put the bottom of one vessel into another vessel, and pour over that alkaline and living lime sweet water which takes those with a finger, and once you have compressed them well with your hand for good compression, and let the vessel that is emptied of the sharp water be in the vessel that has been emptied.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	And then adjust all that water, and pour it over another living lime and other renewed alkaline, because that water will be very strong and sharp, which is administered in many operations of medicine and in cauterization of the other members, for a fire operation.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And of the medicines some are those with which it is cauterized, like tar and honey and melted wax mixed together.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	And Gualia recounts from an ancient man the operation and the cure with which is cured pain of water and of vein sciatica, and magnifies many things about that, and says that there is no need for another cure, and that it is healed by a single glance, just as one recommends, for the strong effect that this has in bathing and he had already said that it was enough.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And it is that a green paste is applied, and if no green paste is found, a fresh fig is applied; and the moss is trampled with a few grapes and placed on the ankle where the pain is, or on the thigh, or on the leg, and is tied.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And it is left there for a duration of three hours or for the amount of time that the patient feels relief from the adjustment.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	Then put him in a bath and when his body is sweating, dip him into the mud, for the pain ceases and he is healed.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And be aware that it's not suitable to use cautery with these medicines, but rather the evacuation of the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	Moreover, Escorides says that when the vein of the calf is cut, it should be cauterized; and apply to the wound in this manner: take a wool and soak it in old oil, and place it between the toes of the foot and between the metatarsal bones.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	And then take a dry calf vein and burn it in the fire until it becomes charcoal; and apply it to the wool and tie it on so that it is held tight.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And then repeat this, and do not stop doing it until the inflammation of the bite has passed into the ankle and relieved the pain.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this manner of cautery is called cow's cautery.

De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Of the cauterization of fractures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When there is a fracture in the limbs and intestines are coming out through the hernia, and this is a common occurrence, then advise the patient to leave their food for that day and to use soothing remedies so that the wound of their belly may heal.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	And then follow the patient with your hands on their back, and command them to hold their arm inside so that it may be supported or held in case the hernia or intestine comes out.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	And then return to the areas that have been mentioned and examine for rupture on the bone of the pelvis with sign of fracture on the extremity which seems similar to the circle of the divided parts of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then apply the cautery, of which this is the form:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	Into that which is moved by red and yellow bile.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	And return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area so that the intestine does not come out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	And you have already opened the space between the patient's thighs and placed a cushion under them, another servant is beside their legs, and another on their chest, who holds their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	And then place the cautery on that sign with your hand, and if it is right, so that in the patient's consciousness the bone enters into the middle of the buttocks; and repeat this other procedure if you have not succeeded in the first procedure.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And observe carefully the movement of the intestine during the time of your cautery, that you do not touch that intestine so that the patient does not come into death or other great evil.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And know that when you have the cautery, if you do not touch the bone, your operation is not effective.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And it is fitting that the cautery of children be subtle according to their size and measure.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	And then treat the place of the cautery for three days with a bandage until the wound is healed by the heat.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that one with other ointments until it is healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And let the patient lie on their back for forty days until the place and the wound are sealed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And take care that you administer nourishment to them according to the length of time of their treatment, which will allow their belly to digest, and that the intestine does not come out due to the effort of straining.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And then when they want to get up after forty days, administer a moderate and decent diet, and keep them like that for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And let them be spared from work and from eating rich food and from drinking, and from violent vomiting, for when they use this regimen of complete healing they will be healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I will describe the treatment of ruptures in other parts of the belly, and so from the beginning, and it is not necessary to repeat, then cauterize the rupture of that one with a heated cautery according to its quantity, and let it be what is exuded from the coda thus as the third part of it; and then treat that one with what we have said, and it is not suitable.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And I have already said to some first that the rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this form, because it is touched with a tent.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And a paused line is made through the width in the flesh above the rupture, and another line below; and pause your hand with a cautery key, but the first cautery is put more gently and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	Of the cauterization of the torso.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain is entrenched in some members by blow or by percussion and the pain persists for a long time and does not respond to treatment with medicines, then it is advisable to cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And the cautery should be of the entire member according to its size and smallness, and its virtue and development, and location on the torso and pain of it.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Therefore if it is healed by the first cautery, it is good; and if not, then repeat on it the cautery; for it is customary with those pains that they be punctured in the member to which it approaches, because it is advisable to continue with the cauteries until the patient is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	Of the cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Lepers are sometimes treated with a cautery for great benefit, and especially if the type of leprosy that is made by putrefaction of blood and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And so if you want to cauterize that person, consider if the leprosy is contagious and if that treatment is with what we have said in the division and not otherwise, and you fear for the patient that the corruption will comprehend the entire body of theirs and their entire complexity, then cauterize that person on the head with 5 cauteries: one in the middle of the head, and one on the right side of theirs, and one on the forehead to the end of the hair; and two on the horns; and one at the back, on the nape or neck.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally, put your hand on the cautery for a little while to press into the bone a small impression, and let their shoulders be dislocated so that the expulsion of gross vapors is alleviated from them; and cauterize on the middle as it is prescribed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy has already spread over the patient and appears manifestly, then it is advisable that you cauterize that person with those cauteries which we have mentioned on the head; and a cautery on the tip of the nose, and two cauteries on the two clavicles, and two cauteries on two vertebrae of the neck, and six cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and one large one near the coccyx, and one on the coccyx, and two on the hips, and one on each hip, and two on the knees and one on each knee, and two on the elbows, and two on the muscles, and two on the tendons of the sixth rib; and cauterize that person on all the joints of the limbs and thighs, and on each heel of their feet, and on the soles of their thighs.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	Be careful with the nerves that are on the sole of the foot, so you don't hurt them.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And in some cases it is cauterized with a cautery on the bone of the kneecap and another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the liver.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that the more adjustments of cauteries you make, the more beneficial and effective they are; and know that the patient does not have pain from the cautery, unlike their usual ailments, because the body of the patient is already numb.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And it is seen that the cauteries are large or small according to the limbs and the joints, as it is determined by the species of the instruments.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the cautery with flour of burnt earth, mixed with honey and with another remedy until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	On the cauterization of numbness.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a limb is numb or paralyzed and is treated with medicines, oils, and plasters, and is not healed, then you cauterize that numb limb with cauteries according to the size of the limb or its smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let the cautery penetrate the thickness of the skin a little.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the one who has entered into the anointing that will bring health.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And some treated areas are cauterized with a stupor that affects the hands and feet, and the spine and back, which is the seat of the nerves, which govern that member, and the stupor is relieved.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	But do not touch that except for one who is wise in the anatomy of the members and the path of the nerves throughout the entire moving body.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On the cauterization of ulcers that are gangrenous.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When an ulcer is old and does not respond to the poultices of medical ointments, then you cauterize it with a cautery iron, taking a little according to the quantity of the species of the cod Liver, until the whiteness and color of it are restored, and its color is changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the one who has a poultice made from flour of oats and lentils with oil of rose and leaves of wormwood, and blood of pigeon or blood of swallow, each one a portion and all mixed together, and then it is applied as a plaster on the area where it will bring healing.
Capitol .l.	Chapter 50.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	Of cauterization of cancer.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer is suspected and you want to treat it, then cauterize it with a circular cautery around the circumference of the affected area as it is turned.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And the wise men say that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle place; but to me it is not visible, because I fear that it will be ulcerated, and I have already seen this happen several times.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	And it is better to cauterize around the circumference with a circular cautery as we have said, or with multiple small cauteries.
Capitol .li.	Chapter fifty-one.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	Of the cauterization of anal fistula.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When some anal fistula is delayed in maturation, and this is due to the excess of material that forms it, or because of the age of the patient, who is old and decrepit, with little blood, or because of the time, and you want to hasten the maturation of the fistula; then cauterize around it with many small sharp points; and immediately apply a dressing so that it will close in maturation.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	But if you want to make a perforation with the cautery, then ignite the cautery of which this is the shape, and apply it to the middle place of the fistula until it penetrates the skin.
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery is applied in that place where it is put, so that the body of the arm is alleviated; then carefully treat that interior part that needs to be healed.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter Two.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On the cauterization of corrosive substances.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corrosive is a wandering corruption in the limb, which corrodes that part as fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you see that corrosive substance in a place where the cautery is suffering from fire, then ignite small irons, and apply them in a gentle and gradual manner, as is convenient in that place where the corrosion is.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then cauterize that entire inner part from which the corruption radiates, so that all of the corrosion is eradicated and no cause of it remains.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And then let it be for three days, and apply on the cauterized places a dressing made with oil mixed with other things, so that the scars are entirely eradicated and all of the corruption.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And then treat it with an ointment that generates flesh.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three days you see that healthy flesh is born in which there is no corruption, that's good; but if not, then repeat the cautery on that which remains rotten in the corrupted places.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	Eating away is a medical treatment with some sharp medicines, for that is a substitute in place of cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	More often cautery is made at the focus of the pus to drain it gently.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And already I have said the cure of it with sharp medicine in division, and therefore take that one when of its urgent need.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 3.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	Of the cauterization of wounds and of the other similar things.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Matters to be considered in the divisions of the foot of a patient who is called clau, and it is a gross cause, an entry, which damages the foot; and cauterization in these is according to two methods, that is cauterization by fire and cauterization by hot water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	The most common method of cauterization by fire is that you should make the cautery resemble a pen for writing, which should be made of iron according to the quantity that the wound contains, and it should have subtle edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then apply the ignited instrument to the wound, and then turn your hand with the cautery in the circuit of the wound until the cautery penetrates to the depth of the wound.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And leave it there for three days until pus starts to flow out.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then apply a plaster made from wild mallows crushed with salt, and place the plaster on that area for nine nights, so that it will eradicate the root of the ailment.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the area with an ointment made from generated flesh, so that it will be healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not convert, and warts appear on the surface of the body, especially on the hands and feet, then take a cautery iron in water, and take a needle of iron or of stone or of pumice stone, and place that on the nail; and then put a small quantity of hot water into the needle, and hold your hand back, and you turn that with compression of your hand, and press the edge of the needle on the root of the nail, and introduce the hot water through the pressure of the root of the nail; and let the patient wait a little for the penetration of the hot water for one hour, and then remove it, so that the nail with its roots will be eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus do the same on those areas and then apply another one so that it comes out all over their joints in the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then heal those areas where the roots of the nails have been eradicated with ointments that generate flesh.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter Four.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On the cauterization of trembling.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When you have a patient with trembling caused by cold in the nerves or by fever of any cause, then it is advisable that you cauterize them with four cauterizations or five on the spine of the back, between each vertebra a cauterization; and a cauterization on their chest, and another on their stomach, an olive tree cauterization.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the trembling of his is relieved and the health of the cold illness is restored.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter Five.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On the cauterization of accidental wounds to the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When in the body there are protruding wounds and there are pus-filled sores which are made of gross corrupted matter; then it is advisable at the beginning of the treatment, that it be cauterized on every head of the fistula with a subtle cauterization, or with a burning of myrrh, whose extremity is extended to the focus; or with a razor of long aristology; or with a viscous cauterization.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And some wounds are cauterized at the beginning of their expulsion in this manner; and they are not believed to be credible, and the excess is broken up, making them healthy, and curing them.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	Maybe the emperor ordered that this be done with proper evacuation of the blood.
Capitol lvi.	Chapter 56.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	On the cauterization of abnormal flow of blood by surgical incision of the artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Treatments applied to stop the flow of arterial blood that is cut due to a wound which cuts too deeply, or due to an incision of abscesses or cauterization of a limb, and it seems similar, and it is difficult to restore that.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore when it happens to someone, then you should press with your hand on the orifice of the artery, and place over that the ligature or bandage so that it holds and tightens those applied remedies inside which block the flow of blood, and do not let it come out.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And then apply to the focus of the cauterized places warm and large poultices, by name "motions", and blow on those inside so that they are ignited.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take from those a small or large piece of vein from the location and the wound in which the artery is broken, and sew it onto that place firmly so that you have restored the ligature, and apply the cauterization inside so that the blood is constricted and restrained.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the orifice of the artery when you remove the tie and extract the cautery, then take another cautery carefully from the cauteries that are prepared in the fire, and do not cease to apply it until the blood is constricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And beware that you do not touch the nerve that is here, and let another evil come upon the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And be aware that when the artery flows with blood, it is not possible to constrict the blood in those cases, and especially when the artery is large, unless one of four methods is used: either with a cautery as mentioned before, or with extraction when it has not been extracted, because when it is extracted the extremities of the member are burned and the blood is constricted, or that it is tied with a thread or with a ligature for strong constriction, or that they are applied with medicines whose virtue is to constrict the blood; and they are strengthened with a pillow or with a bandage.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	More importantly, one who administers a decent constriction with a ligature and a bandage or with clothes, or by the position of causes that burn and of similarities, does not do so hastily but gently.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	If that pain should be intense and the doctor is not present nor medicine available, then apply a warm poultice to the aforementioned orifice of that vein as we have said, and understand that in the great constriction of the intestine the blood is stopped from the upper part of the wound, and on the area above it is not warmed; and above the area apply a cold and very chilly water to congeal and thicken the blood; and consider if there should be applied a cauterization or medicine of necessity.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second section.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and perforation, and of evacuations, and of phlebotomy, and of wounds and their similars.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the teachings of Albucazis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all the illnesses in which a hot cauterization is convenient and with medicine to burn, and the occasions and causes of it, and the necessary instruments for the forms of the cauterizations; and we have ordered the chapters concerning the subjection of the head to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And we will proceed in this chapter for that medical treatment, so that it may be alleviated what the seeker of it is looking for, namely regarding what has been requested.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	It seems that you should begin by warning them about this, son, that they learn in this chapter the fear of what is in the first chapter of cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And because of this, beware that there is great caution, for in the operation which is in this chapter, many careful observations are needed to evacuate what is with blood or on the vein or incision on the posthem or apprehension of tissue or purification of the wound or extraction of the arrow or incision of the skin and similar things.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And all those things are accompanied by fear and trembling, and in their hands there is almost always death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that upon you does not fall what is in the aforementioned, for some observations are dependent on you to have good manners as men and many manners of illnesses.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And of them, it is some that flee with their illness and fear the death, and also because of the violence of what they find in their illness, and for the length of their illness, and in the illness there is a fear which means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of those, it is one who gives you to understand and say, you hoping for health, and their illness is pernicious.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	Therefore do not believe in that which you see of the one who comes to you with this treatment; and your caution should be greater than credulity and your recklessness; and do not presume any cause concerning this except through certain science which verifies what you must do, and for which successful outcome is awaited.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use it in the cure of all your illnesses of prognosis and indication to him who is health converted, for in that you are helped with the acquisition of fame and memory, of praise and of glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, sons, God inspire in you the divine understanding and grant you direction and protection, for this is in his hands.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have written and ordered this chapter distinctly by chapters as it precedes in the chapter of cauteries, of the cure from head to feet, so that it may be facilitated for you what you demand of it and of which you have need.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the cure of water that is contained in the head of infants.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this illness, often seen in infants, must be given the treatment and when the nurse tightens the head of the infant it loses its vivacity.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And some times it happens for an unknown cause which is not understood.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	I have not seen this illness except in children; and all those who I have seen with it have been killed by it, and thus I consider it a fatal work in them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that a child whose head was filled with water, and the head of it was so magnified to the point that the child could not support itself because of the greatness of its head, and more that the humidity caused an increase until mortal harm.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity or is gathered between the cartilage and the bone, or is gathered under the bone on the siphoid bone (or near the xiphoid process).
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	For the operation in that case where the humidity is between the cartilage and the bone and the abscess is small, then it is necessary to make an incision in the middle of the head with a slit in the width, and let the length of the slit be two nuts so that the humidity can flow out, and this is the shape of the spatulum:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And then if the humidity is even more increased and the abscess is larger, then there are two slits in this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is under the bone, the sign of it is that you see the sutures of the head opened from one end to the other and the water is squeezed out when you press on it with your hand at the separated parts and it does not come back in.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Make sure that you make three incisions in the middle of the head according to this method:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And then extract the entire moisture from the incision; and then wrap the wounds with bandages and plasters; and then apply oil and wine externally on the fifth day, and then uncover the wound and cure it with tents and poultices, and bind the head with equality; and feed the patient with dry food of little humidity until the member is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another method of incision, which considers when the size of the abscess appears and the collection of the water, because some times it is bigger on the occipital bone, or on the front part, or on the right side, or on the left side; and so proceed with the incision where the abscess and the accumulation of the water appear, and do it according to what is most possible for you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And be careful not to cut the artery and do not allow blood flow, lest the patient die from that flow of blood with evacuation of humidity.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter 2.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of the incision of the arteries which are near the ears, called hilassions.
Capitol segon.	Chapter second.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When the disease has progressed to the arteries of the shoulders or the hips, and it is chronic, and the medical treatments do not agree on this, then the last cure in this case begins with the opening of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And then proceed when you want to cut into the scalp of the patient, and rub the area with rough cloth to reveal the arteries, and hold the patient's neck with another cloth; and consider the pulse of the vein; and the places on each one corresponding to the places where you previously pressed the ears, so that they are hidden in some homes.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then mark the artery with a tent, and cut each one in the spatium of each affected part, making a precise incision entering into the bone, and let that be the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want, insert the spatium beside the artery and divide it to reach the incisions in the lower parts.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And let the length of the incision be two fingers adjusted, because when any vein is cut, the blood exits with pulsating egression, which stops with frequent pressure.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear to feeling, then it is necessary that you measure from the ear the quantity of the space of three fingers, and mark with a tent, and make an incision into the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And that which is to be taken from the blood is a quantity of twenty units, and take it from their veins or months, and all that is according to the quantity that appears from the virtue of the patient and the replenishment of their liver.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then consider the wound, and if there remains on the bone any cause of sciatica, then cut it out so that no abscess or tumor forms.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen the wound with bandages and with a dressing of linen cloth, and cure it with an ointment so that it becomes healthy.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the extraction of the blood from the temples which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When to some people an old or chronic disease occurs, due to humid and bad qualities in the temples, or an old and violent pain seems to be in those, and it is treated with the art of medical cures and this does not help, then we have spoken about extraction of blood from the temples, or cauterization of them as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the method of operation and extraction is that the patient scrapes off the skin which is on the temples; and it begins with the apparent vein in the temple, because it appears to you through the blue veins, and is hidden except in few men due to violence of cold.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if the area is concealed, then bind the patient's neck with some cloth; and apply cold compresses to the area with a rough cloth or evaporate the area with hot water until it appears to you that the arthritis is visibly reduced.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then take the spatula, of which this is the shape:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then scrape the channel with that which facilitates entry until you reach the joint; and cut into the tissue and extract that from the upper parts until you extract it from the channel and discover it from the tunics which you had left there, of the whole piece.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is delicate, then wrap it with the extremity of the groin, and cut from it a part according to the quantity by which the extremities of the tissue are lengthened and contracted, and you will not find a flow of blood, for if they are not cut, the blood will not rise at all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then evacuate three cups of blood from the vein.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then it is necessary that you ligate it in two places with double thread of hemp or with cords of flax, and do not allow putrefaction before consolidation of the wound and find a flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then cut away the excess that is between two ligaments; and do this at that hour or at another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you want, cauterize that wound with a cautery iron within the bone with a cutting iron where the extremities of it are cut, and put in place of that defective member.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	It is a better work if the patient has fever or is of hot complexion; for cautery is one of those causes that helps to dry out the harmful moistures, and thus it is better in treatment.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then take out the extraction of the arteries that filled the place of the old abscess, and let them be covered with decently made poultices, and then let it be cured with dry medicines that make the flesh grow and with clamps within which it will be healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you are working another vein is found with a flow of blood from the artery, then restrain that blood, either with a ligature or with a cautery, or fill the place of the cut, and press your hand within so that the blood is restrained.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if none of those causes is at your disposal, then apply a cold dressing on the area so that the blood is congealed, and wrap the area with water of vehement coldness so that the sharp pain subsides, and let it be tightened as needed.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And this is what is called easier extraction of the artery, that you cauterize the vein with this cautery having two handles, since you have sensed the two areas with your finger, and applied it to each one, soft fire, until they penetrate the bone and cut the vein in two areas, so that what is between the extremities of it is elongated, because they are not consolidated at all with this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And its sharpness is in the tips of the two handles.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	It is better if the sharpness is in the handles rather than the tips, because if it is too pointed with two handles it will be more proper to each wound, and it won't cut the flesh quickly.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, when there is some thickness in those areas, the heat of the fire is applied to them and the flesh is cut easily.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this procedure is better than any other procedure and more efficient.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And the space which is between the two handles is the thickness of the said (or aforementioned) thing.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the treatment of bodies with sharp and acidic humors of the veins.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When there are acidic humors, and it is the body of those veins which are on the head, and do not confirm any cause for the treatment of medicine, and times the face of the patient is already reddened and felt in the seat of the forehead a certain form of ambulation, as if it were an ambulation of antimony, and the veins of that one are so attenuated, humid so that already the skin of theirs is constricted, and the eyelids are so scratched by the sharpness of the tears, the ancient wise men mixed in the treatment of those of this operation, and I named this treatment with a pause.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you command the patient to raise the skin where there are wounds on the upper frontal area, and then insert three equal distant slits in the frontal area according to the length of it.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the slit falls into two sections: one slit is equally distant from the length of the nose in the middle area of the forehead, and the second according to the length of a small movement of the tears which are in the lacrimal, and the third on the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And beware of the beginning of the tears which are in two sides, and extend your hand from the continuity of both the jaws.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space between each incision is adjusted to the quantity of three fingers.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a piece of sponge prepared or dried cloth moistened with which to drain the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then insert the spatula between the two sharp extremities, of which this is the form of the incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which is from the partition of the temples to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Scrape out all the cartilage which is between two incisions around the siphac which is above the bone, and then make that from the middle incision to the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then insert a spatula into this space and in the first incision use another instrument called a cutellar, sharp on one side and not sharp on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And push the edge of that sharp instrument through the flesh attached to the cartilage, and the edge of it through the bone, and insert it so that it reaches the middle fissure, and cut off all the veins that descend from the head to the heels.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	More, let the incision be continued to where the cartilage appears, and then make an incision in the middle fissure into the other fissure.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And after that pour out a quantity of blood, squeeze the places of the lumps of congealed blood.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then push into each hot fissure a piece of old cloth, and place on those enclosed powders made with wine and oil and sharp vinegar, and beware that the applied cautery does not produce an abscess.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.
