And on the third day loosen the ligature and administer a large enema of hot water or tea, and then treat it with a mixture of basilicon and oil and rosewater and other ointments so that the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter five.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	On the treatment of ulcers caused by catarrh and descending to the heels from the divisions of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When the liver and spleen are inflamed with catarrh and continuous pain, and the veins of the patient are thin and exhausted, and their protection is weak, and their eyelids are ulcerated and their skin is damaged, and in the forehead there is sharp pain and consequent inflammation, then you will know from this accident that the materials and catarrh do not come except from many worn out veins proceeding from the divided parts.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure for these is this: that you order the patient to shave their forehead, and make an incision in the middle of the forehead, a small one in width (and start from the left temple's fissure to the right temple; and let the incision be up to the bone; and stretch out your hand on the sides of the temples which are swollen due to bad chewing), until the bone is exposed.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry all the blood with a sponge or with dry cloth and fill between the two lips of the incision with old cloth or with yarn.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then strew dust of powder mixed in wine and oil so that it does not foster an apostematic abscess.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you see that the apostema is diminished, then it is time to scrape the bone until new flesh begins to grow, and treat it with a drying regimen which makes the flesh grow, just as if you take two parts of wheat flour and four parts of colophony and mix them, and make a plaster from it, and administer it on these wounds of the reborn flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter six.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the treatment of that which falls into the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	Every cause that falls into the ears is one of four species, either it is mineral matter or similar to mineral, such as iron and copper, or it is from a plant, such as cedar or lavender, or it is fluxible matter, such as water and sharp vinegar and their equivalents, or some animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And then when stone falls into the ear or other cause similar to those that do not fit in the ear, and warm the ear with sunlight, and if necessary grind the stone, then distill it with some oil of violet or cypress, and then administer the extraction of it, and make the person sneeze with condition, and stop the nostrils for fear of sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then put in the ear canal some pieces of cloth or wool, and stretch the ear to the separated parts, because moist heat is introduced with these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it does not come out, then administer extraction of it with the instrument called fine forceps, whose shape is this:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is extracted with the instrument, well; and if not, then administer the extraction of it with a thin hook of little doubling.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And then if it is not perforated by that, make a cane of iron and insert the end of the cane into the trachea of the ear and close around the environment of the cane with wax and oil softened so that it does not hurt except the cane.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract with your finger strongly, because many times seen with what we have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	More if it is not perforated in this manner, then take of alum or of prepared vinegar on which the ears are pressed a small quantity, and place that on the extremity of the vein, and then wrap around that place decently with a poultice.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the trachea of the ear with ease, and then cleanse the ear of humidity.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And then if it is not perforated with all the causes that we have recounted, then you should consider that which appears before as a post or spasm of the apostem or abscess.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of taking that is that you at the beginning sensibly touch the patient's vein sepulchral and extract the blood according to the manner of the virtue of it, and then make that go between your hands and turn the ear to the divided parts, and make a small fissure in the root of the ear and put the fat of it in the place where it is pressed.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And if the lunar figure fissure enters into the stone, and the stone is perforated, then you can use an appropriate instrument; and at that hour apply the fissure with velocity, and cure it so that it becomes healthy.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause in the ear is one of the fatty growths that appear and become inflamed, then administer the cure and extraction of it; but if it does not obey your initial treatment, then take a subtle spatula according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer to him the excision of that growth which has fallen into the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do that when you think that it is already moistened by the vapour of the ear, and put it in several warm applications, and extract it with the nails or with a subtle gesture, or with an incision as has been said before, because the extraction of it is thus alleviated.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water that has entered into the ear, it happens that the patient uses sneezing with conditioned commencement, and fills his other ear with an old cloth, and throws over that ear where the water is, and if by this it is expelled, well; and if not, then take hot stones and wrap them according to the length of the said, and heat them in the fire a little, and let the patient introduce one of these into the opening of his ear and press on the other side of that part with another stone on the stone which is inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore, do not stop until all the water has been expelled from the body.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc i, e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the water has been expelled, take some paper or cloth, and put one end of it in the ear and extend the other end to the fire until it is burned by the fire.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And also put and take another cloth and do it as many times as necessary until all the water is expelled, and squeeze that one with a tube so that what is said about the evacuating pipe is fulfilled.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	More in the extraction of beasts entering into that ear, if it is a small beast, take it out similarly and to its likeness, cure it as we have said in the division; but if it is a large beast which causes pain to the sense of hearing, then administer the extraction with gestures and anointings, and the cause of it is considered lighter than all the other causes that happen in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	Moreover in the extraction of worms generated in the ear, when you cure it with what we have said in the division and in the treatise of distillations and do not confuse your cure, then it is advisable that you expose the ear to the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if any cause of worms appears here, then extract it with gestures or with subtle anointings, but if no cause appears, then take a pipe, narrow and wide at the end, whose form is like this:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	Insert the subtle extremity into the ear according to the quantity that the patient can suffer; and suck it strongly with a forceful suction, and make well-observed movements, until all the worms are expelled.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	If it does not obey your treatment, then block and close the circuit of the vein with wax in the same way as we have said; then administer distilled liquids which the ancients have already proven in the cure of worms, and you will find this in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your effusion be that with which you pour the medicinal oils into the ear, using this instrument of which this is the form:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	Make it of silver or of brass, narrow, in which there is a small hole, and placed below.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And then it will be as if they are filling what is in the cavity of the vein, where it will be necessary here.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you want, take the rod and envelop it decently in the extremity of the cloth, and put oil or juice of some herb, or whatever you want of these medicines into the vein — which is in the ear —, and then insert the rod with cloth below and press with your hand a tempered compression so that the oil is expelled into the cavity of the hearing and the patient feels the oil penetrating.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And that which is infiltrated in the ear should already be scaled with a small focus.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And beware that the cause which you distillate in the ear is not too cold, because ear medications do not tolerate this.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the treatment of obstruction of the ears.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some observed that some infants have non-perforated naval areas, and this also occurs in some men, obstruction in the middle of the ear due to a plague or flesh growing in it; and this obstruction sometimes happens in the passage of the ear's duct, which doesn't allow for hearing, and sometimes it is in the outer parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which occurs in its passage, which doesn't allow for hearing, is among the major conditions of difficult healing.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that case where you achieve hearing, take care to place the patient's ear in the sunlight and observe it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then if you see apparent obstruction, open it with a subtle spatula, of which this is the shape:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity of it, in which the width is small, one part is pointed and the other not, and the spatula is of two smooth sides so that it does not make a lesion on the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And so if the obstruction is caused by flesh born in the ear or in the middle of it, then apply a subtle and incisive instrument with vehement facility until all the flesh is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the obstruction is in the hole of the ear, then take a subtle iron and heat it in a fire for a little while, and place it in the middle of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And so if you have felt the obstruction with the instrument that the patient feels with ease, due to the gravity of hearing, relieve the oppression of it with ease; and be careful not to harm the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And place a poultice in the ear, made of wax according to the quantity of the size of the wound, which you have enveloped in Egyptian ointment; and do this for several days until you are sure of the consolidation of the wound; or take cotton and soak it in vinegar and sprinkle powdered treatise on it and use it; and if the ear has become infected, then remove the poultice and replace it with another one which you will have wrapped in wax mixed with rose oil, until the infection is cauterized; and heal it until it is cured.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	When there is an excessive flow of blood, then submerge a sponge or cloth in cold water and apply it to the ear, and use another treatment that restricts the flow of blood, which is described in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 3.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the treatment of a disease that causes inflammation to the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athezil, which causes inflammation to the eyelids of the eyes, sometimes is humid, sometimes is dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, hold those in your hands or with your fingers, and cut them away from the roots of their causes, and apply pressure on the affected areas following the treatment.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	When there is pain with a flow of blood, then you should cauterize those areas with a subtle, lancet-shaped cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is when the incisions and wet wounds return to health once their causes are removed; and when they are cauterized with a hot iron, those roots are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment of cataract that comes to the eyelids of the eyes.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Wet spots appear on the eyelids of the eyes due to some cause which is similar to cataract in its strength and hardness, and because of this it is called cataract.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	It is an accumulation of thick humidity in the eyelid and underneath.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the operation on them is what you should consider if the growth proceeds from it in that which appears of the eyelid and is obstructing the entire sight; and the cause of it is laziness.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Then make an incision on that with a lancet, and carefully remove the entire growth with ease until it comes out, and elevate that with a clamp and cut that off.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	Unless the start of it is not apparent to you, then make a small and gradual incision so that you penetrate the eyelid with a slight cut, for this will not harm in any case.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the wound is large, then you adjust it with a suture; and cure it until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not suffer harm from that which the angle of it, restoring and fleshing out.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the growth is leaning towards the inner parts of the eyelid, remove it from the surface, then take up the eyelid and with a clamp remove the growth, or if you need to make an incision, press on the entire area, and if the eyelid is lengthened by the incision, this will not harm in any case.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the treatment, wash the wound with salty water; and cure the area with liquid that promotes healing inside until it is healthy.
Capitol .x.	Head or Chapter
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Of the treatment of the eyelid wound on the underside of the eye.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	A stye is a grievous thing which is generated in the linings of the lower eyelid, and mostly occurs in children, it aggravates the eyes of those who have it and makes them blind; and they cannot look at the clarity of the sun because tears are collected in their eyes.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And because of this they rub their eyes with their hands for a long time, and they sleep with their hands on their eyes; and the eyelids of their eyes become humid, which already has been covered by inflammation and swelling, and apparent acne in the eye; and when you press the area with your fingers, you feel the hardness inside their eyes.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And a certain method of operation is in that the patient holds his sick head in his hand, and then holds a cloth of linen and of wool, and makes a circle according to the quantity which contains the entire affected area, and then places that on it and presses with the fingers from all sides so that hardness is accumulated in the middle of the circle, and then puts it in the middle of that humid place with spittle incident on the fissure for the width, and the fissure is not larger than the one made in phlebotomy.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	More in the press that you find the entire code within which you arrive at the liver, because in the more dispositional processes of the liver it proceeds by fissure according to the form of white gray matter.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut. E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And beware that you do not adjust in the fissure so that with the spatulum you do not reach the hole and that you do not touch that.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils. E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And thus apply that you sprinkle salt and place it in the cavity of the fissure so that it absorbs the remainder of that humidity.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then heal it until it is healthy.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	More if there appears on the spot a hot aposteme, then heal it with cold plasters until it is healthy.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.

Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the cure of ulcers which are made on the eyelids.

Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.

Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	On the dissection of the nail and the protrusion of flesh of the tear ducts.

And they are made of iron or of steel properly, and the extremities of theirs are to this subtlety triangular, the extremity sharp thus as that is the form.
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter 24.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	Of the healing of flesh in the nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When in the nose there are born diverse flesh growths adapted from which some cause is assembled with the tail of a fish called polyp, or a polypus; and this sickness is called polypus for its resemblance to that fish represented.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And of it is flesh that is cancerous, rough, of dark color; and of it is flesh that is not of dark color.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore in that which is in these flesh growths not deceitful nor cancerous, it is good to make the sickness seep between your hands and put it in the sun, and breathe into its nostrils, and prick the tissue once in those growths.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And then extract that from the divided parts of the flesh, and then dissect what you have comprehended of those with sharp subtlety of one part within which you know that all the flesh is already removed; for if it remains of it a cause of which the removal is possible, then you will use one of the subtle instruments with ease within which from its removal a cause.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	More often if the wound is bloody or acidic with an aposteme (or ulcer), then stop that which flows; or if it's one of the malignant ulcers, then touch and cauterize that within which there will be separated blood and all the cavities will be removed.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And then let it be put into the nose, a mixture of vinegar or wine and water.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is opened and its process humidity enters the palate, then know that it is already healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the humidity does not penetrate as it should, then you will know that the flesh is nothing in the purulent ulcers of the nose's bones to which separation has not been achieved.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore it follows that you will put a thread of linen to which some thickness is added, and knot the thread with knots, and place between each knot the quantity of the said or measured, and anoint the patient and put one end of the thread in the nose with a straw or another instrument by which it is possible.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And then it is made so that the aura is generated, which attracts the upper odor to the point where it penetrates the channels of the nostrils, and it is ejected over the upper throat, because repeated vomits seem to be the cause of this action for the schools, and it is a legitimate reason for one who wants to do it.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And then pause with the two extremities of the vein, one extremity that goes over the nose and the other that remains in the nose, and then administer a closure of flesh to the nodes that are on the vein, and make it so that you know that the flesh is already at the nodes of the vein.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And then extract the vein, and pause on the nose with the abstraction of blood a little, and make it so for three days or more until the ointment corrodes all that is rotten of the flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And then at the end of the treatment, put in the nose a tube of lead for several days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	More if there are signs of recovery that appear, make use of that.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument to purge the head which causes distilled oils and medicines to be in the nostrils:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	Make it of silver or of copper, which is similar to a small covered lamp, thus like a small funnel, and the middle similarly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you want, make a closed cane like a reed, and the handle of the instrument should be at the top, flat and uncovered; on which you should put a hand in the back of it, with which you hold that which you extract from it, or that which you want from its juices and sucked causes.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And this top part is precious: take a recipe of castor oil, white henna, ginger, and a pinch of saffron, long pepper, skinkus, and petum of spice one ounce, mixed with juice of beets and cabbage, and make into pills, and let one pill be dissolved in warm water, and give it to the patient sitting in a leaning position.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of the ulcers born on the outer extremities of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Ulcers born on the outer extremities of the nose are called green ulcers, and are treated and anointed for several days during which time one must guard oneself from it.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And for this reason you should write that at the beginning of the appearance of it, and inherit all that.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	Then apply a cauterization or medicine that burns to the area where it was, or a treatment in place of it.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	If the incision is delayed until it becomes swollen, then consider if it is hardened, of dark color and with little sensation, do not touch that part with iron for fear of causing an aposteme or cancer; because many times this has been seen to happen to one who performs this incision, due to great malice upon the one on whom it was performed.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the aposteme is of a yellowish touch and not of dark color, and at times when incision is possible on the entire thing, then evacuate the patient and perform the incision without fear, and treat the area with that which expels and constricts until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the suture of the nose and of the lips and of the ear when continuity is dissolved by a wound or by similarity.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	It is known that when there occurs a solution of continuity in one of these cartilages, little confidence is placed in that operation except by some men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when you come upon some cause of these, consider if it is a fresh wound with good blood, and then adjust the two lips of the wound with suture, and carefully treat that area until it is healed.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of the solution of continuity are already separated, and each one is made healthy, then it is necessary that you extract each part of its own mucous membrane until healthy flesh appears.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the two lips of the wound with suture and strengthen them, and on top of them sprinkle powdered dragon's blood and crushed tristicum, and place on the powder a piece of plaster or another consolidating plaster, and leave that poultice on for two or three days, and then remove it and change the plaster and leave it on until the wound is scarring and the edges are separated, and then heal with ointment until it is healthy.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	The method of the suture is that you add the solution of continuity or with needles as we have recommended in the suture of the belly, or add the solution of continuity to the edge as you know how to do.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of extraction of those causes that come in the two lips in the divided teeth.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Some swollen nodes appear on the divided teeth of their lips, some abscesses similar to grass of oats, and some of them are minor and some are major.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, you should convert the lips and wounds each one of those hardnesses of the whole part, and then with the abscess drained, fill the place with tristicum powder so that the blood is restrained, and then wash with warm water and treat the place with what is stipulated, until it is healthy.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of the incision of the flesh adjusted in the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Gather the excess flesh over the adjusted gum, which the ancients called albulus, and see that you suspend or hold that one with a forceps or clamps, and make an incision in that place, and let the blood flow or the wound.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And then apply a dressing on the wounded location, either with astringent powders or excitative ones.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, then incise it secondarily, and cauterize it, so that the cautery will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of the root of rotten teeth.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When on the surface of the teeth that are divided, separated, and in the gums that are adjusted, scorched, rough, and some growths are blackened and made citrine or green within which the gum is seen to be corrupted and the loose teeth are decayed.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And then see that you make the patient sit between your knees and place their head on your thigh, and examine the teeth in which those roughnesses and causes of bad appearance appear, like sand within which no cause of harm remains, and this comes from blackness and citrinity and other things that are deformed.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	Therefore, if the blockage is in the beginning of the digestive process, that's what it is; and if not, then you will pass the digestive product through the other days and to the second and third intestine until it comes to the last statement in what you want.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that the teeth have need of various shapes and forms of mallets according to what is prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And because the mallet with which the tooth is extracted from its partition is different from the mallet with which it is extracted between the teeth according to other forms, and these forms of mallets should be prepared by you, whichever ones you will see:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter thirty.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of the extraction of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	When you treat the tooth of its pain with all skill and delay in the entire extraction of it, because it is not a trivial cause that should suffice to remove it when it is eradicated, because it is a subtle substance involved in the excuse for the extraction of it.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	Before you attempt to extract the tooth from the patient, you should be firmly certain which is the painful tooth, because many times the pain deceives the patient and they think it's in a healthy tooth, and you extract that one and then the pain doesn't cease until the diseased and painful tooth is extracted, for we have already seen this through the operation of the barbers.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, when you have certified what the aching tooth is, and what you know to be, then seek out in the circuit of the tooth with spatula in which some virtue is, until it is dissolved from the tooth of the gum of the entire part, and then rub that one with the fingers or with subtle fork at the beginning small by small until that congeals.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then put in the strong tongs holding for good eloquence or strong structure, and place the head of the patient between the teeth that you hold so that it does not move, and pull the tooth according to rectitude in a manner that you do not break it, nor give the patient greater pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And therefore if it is not forced out, then take one of those instruments, and put that under the entire part with facility and effort, to ease the removal of it, so that it is done from the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is damaged or decayed, then seek that you fill with cloth that hole and tighten it at the extremity of a subtle thread so that it is not torn in the hour of your construction over it, holding it.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And seek that you open with excavation in the circuit of the entire part of the gum and guard with your strength that you do not break it and rend and tear a part of it, and return to the patient for the malice that is less than the primary pain of it.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And beware that you do not perform what ignorant and arrogant barbers do in their pretension and boldness regarding the eradication of it, which they do not administer as we have recommended; because many witnessed things bring about great maladies in men, which are more difficult to treat, and the roots of them are all or some of them, or that you extract that with some bones of the jaw, as many witnessed things have testified.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And for the eradication of it, let the mouth be washed with six or seven bitter salts.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if there is an efflux of blood through the mouth, as many witnessed things have shown, then sprinkle a certain quantity of ashes and dust on the wound, and if that ash does not work, apply cautery.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The shape of the forceps and tongs should be subtle with which the tooth is pulled at the beginning being of long extraction, with a short handle and thick, so that they are not bent when you have to work with them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And let them be like this, of thick handle between so that when you grip them they are not bent, but rather short and slender.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And let them be made of Indian iron, well-made and slender, and in the slenderness of those let there be teeth which one enters into the other and grips with strong construction, and some witnessed things, the slenderness of those is the shape of a bird's beak, which has the name ciconia, that is guanta, and are of strong construction.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter twenty-one.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On the eradication of teeth and extraction of bones from fractured jaws.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you need to eradicate a tooth that is fractured due to some cause, then it is advisable that you apply a poultice on the area with a bandage for a day or two until the area becomes softened; and then insert the handle of the tongs or forceps, the extremities of which are assembled at the beak of a hook called ciconia or guanta, the shape of the forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The extremities of them should be made like a file or a rasp.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if it does not obey to your efforts with these forceps or tongs, then it is advisable that you cut into the root and scrape away all the flesh and insert the instrument which has the name "atali", which is a small lever the shape of which is this:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And let it be of brief extremity, thick and not bent so that it is not fractured.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore, if by this the root is cut through, well and good; and if not, help yourself with these other instruments of which the following are the shapes: the shape of the first instrument is triangular at the extremity in which there is some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it should be triangular and have a subtle, pointed extremity.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And thus helped with this instrument having two grooves of which this is the shape suitable for the following:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and with other instruments which I will describe in the scraping of teeth; because it is made with this instrument which is assembled to a large file, and this is the shape:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	of the triangular pointed extremity, whether twisted or short, which should have some thickness, and not be sharpened so that it is not scratched.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And you should know that the instruments for the teeth are moved thus and similarly the other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the skilled and subtle artisan in the art, finds for himself according to what it means for the operation and various ailments; because there are ailments for which the ancients did not make or even think of a proper instrument, due to the forms of diverse species.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the bone of the jaw or of the other bones of the mouth is fractured, or if it is broken, then weigh carefully on that location with what is convenient for the instruments and the forceps which we have mentioned in the extraction of the roots of the teeth, and help yourself with the gesture of which this is the shape:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And let there be on the opening a small, gradually increasing tightness, and let it be constricted or held at the mouth so that it does not escape or flee until the whole bone is fortified; and then restore the area with medicines suitable for this condition.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If there is a small perforation in the bone, then take away that part of the decay and its blackness, and cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter thirty-two.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	On the treatment of teeth that protrude above the others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When the teeth protrude not according to their natural body, in that case the form is flawed, and especially when it happens to women, and especially to venerable old ladies; therefore I advise you to consider: if a tooth has no contact with another tooth, and there is no possible arrangement or alignment of it, then extract that tooth; but if it is not attached to another tooth, then cut that one with this instrument, the shape of which is like this; and it should be made from Indian steel, extremely sharp.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And let your incision be the one with which you cut it, for several days due to the hardness of the tooth, and let it not be sharpened by another of the teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if there is an eminent stone that appears in the bile, then clean it with a file made of iron from India, of which this is the form:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And let it be all of iron from India and with an edge; and let it be with many small points, like a file, with which the needles are made, with which the tooth is cleaned little by little over many days with ease, so that there is not another tooth that grows and falls.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And then anoint that end with a bandage, and give it to the patients to lick.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if it is a tooth of which one part is loose and the tongue touches it, then make sure that you smooth out the roughness so that the splinter of that fraction is hidden and swallowed, and is pressed down so that the tongue does not wound it and the speech is not corrupted.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter thirty-three.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of the restoration of decayed teeth with gold or silver wire.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When the teeth in front are knocked out by concussion and removal through percussion or extraction, and the patient cannot chew on what they eat, and you have treated it with medications that dry up the area, and your treatment has not been effective, then so that nothing is cast into those that are strengthened with gold wire and not silver, because silver becomes black and immediately turns to powder after a few days, but gold in no time is changed.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And let the thread be of such subtlety and thickness according to the quantity that can enter between the teeth; and the form of the reception is that you take the thread and take double its length between two healthy teeth, and then tie knots with two twists of the thread between two molars, or one or more, until the thread reaches the healthy tooth on the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And then pull the suture back to the part where you started, and hold your hand with ease and skill so that it is not bitten.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let your tightening be such that you hold the thread between the roots of the teeth so that it does not come loose.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And then cut off the excess threads with forceps or scissors, and add them to each place as needed, and hide them between the healthy tooth and the molar, so that they do not cause injury to the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then leave that thus tightened like a Roman.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loose or broken, hold it or them with another thread in such a manner for all the time.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of the teeth and the figure of the correction of two healthy teeth and two molars, thus with these threads tied:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when it happens that one or both teeth are returned to their proper place in the jaw, and the tissues are reconnected as we have recommended, and the gums recover.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And do not do this unless you are skilled and knowledgeable.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And some bridgework is made from the bones of a cow, and is shaped like a tooth, and is placed in the location where the tooth is missing, and is tightened as we have said, and remains and serves for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter thirty-four.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the incision of the ligament which comes in the tongue and prohibits speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament which comes with the tongue sometimes is natural to man, or is accidental and happens by a wound which has already consolidated.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation on it is that you open the mouth of the patient, their head being held firm in your tie; and you lift their tongue, and then cut the nervous ligament according to the width by which the tongue is bound.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is any hardness or knot in it, and this has been caused by the consolidation of the wound, then you cut and divide it by the width through which you have cut the ligament and the knot is dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And beware that there is not made a fissure in the press of the flesh and that you separate the artery here and come blood flux.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	Then wash the vestiges of the incision with warm water or wine or cold water; and then put a clean cloth on it, which is the method by which you hold the patient's tongue in each wound so that it is not consolidated into another ulcer.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	More often if blood flux happens, put on the place a burnt and crushed verdigris; more often if the blood comes out, then cauterize the place with a broad and flat cautery that is convenient for this purpose.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then heal it with other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	On the extraction of a ranula from the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Certain ulcers happen on the tongue, an aposteme similar to a small wound, hindering the tongue from its natural operation; and so it is magnified until it fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation on it is that you open the mouth of the patient sitting in front of you and examine the aposteme.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it of dark or black color, hard, in which the patient has no feeling, then do not touch that which is cancer.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it declines to whiteness, in which there is humidity, then put the ankle in a poultice, and cut that with a subtle spatula, and cut from the entire affected part; and if blood comes out during the time of your operation, then stop the bleeding immediately, so that the blood is restrained.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then return to your work, until you have treated it with a complement of wine and vinegar and salt; and cure it with another cure adapted to that until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter thirty-six.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of the extraction of abscesses from both ears and of that which is born in the throat and of other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When there is a swelling in the throat, then there are glands that are gathered together, which protrude outward and are called ears, which when you treat with what we have said in the division and it is not healed, then consider if the abscess is hard, of dark color, of little feeling, then do not touch it with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of red color and the root is thick, then do not touch it with iron because of the flow of blood; let it be until it is matured, and then you will operate on it, or it will break by itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of a white color, redness, and the root of it is subtle, then that is what is thought to be the onset of the disease.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation on it is what you consider, during your operation, if the apostema has already been treated with a complete or partial cautery; and then examine the patient in the sunlight, and let their head be in a raised position, and open their mouth, and the servant should hold between their hands to press the tongue of the patient with an instrument of noble movement, from which this is the form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And let it be made of silver or copper, and let it be subtle as a knife.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Then when you press on that tongue and it shows you the apostema, and you see above it the raised vein, then take the needle and put it in the amenal, and pull it to the outer parts from there as much as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Or also that which you pull out, some cause of the tunics, and then cut it with an instrument of which this is the form:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and it is assembled with forceps, however the extremities of it are curved, such that the orifice of each one of them is in the hollow of the other, with sharp edges, which should be of iron or forged.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	If this instrument is not at your present, then describe that spatula from which this is the shape of: And be sharp on one side, not sharp on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And since you have made an incision, make the other according to this same method of incision, and apply the incision to the patient's wound with cold water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If there is an efflux of blood, apply water from the decoction of the seed of milgrana or of the leaf of mirtra and similar to that for stopping causes, so that the flow of blood is restrained, and treat that which is sick.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And some abscesses appear in the groin or other swollen parts, and incise those according to what was said and written about the incision of two similar swellings.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I have already treated a woman for an abscess which had formed in her groin, the abscess was of a dark color, with little sensation, which had already closed the groin, and the woman breathed with difficulty, and she had been prohibited from eating and drinking water, and she would have been near death if the treatment had been delayed by one or two days.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had already pushed so much that it had formed two openings between which a pus flowed out through two channels.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Then I cut through the flesh and put my finger in one of the openings, and pulled it out, and a large amount of pus was thrown out from him, and I made an incision in the other opening to meet with the first one, and I forced open his mouth, and compressed his tongue, and then I put my finger in the opening into the abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then I cut out a large part of it, and there didn't flow much blood from it except for a little bit.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Therefore the abscess of that woman was completely removed, and she began to drink water, and then took a diet, therefore I did not see any more discharge from that abscess for a long time, and another abscess formed in its place, which discharged between the space where it was prolonged.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Then I applied an iron and cauterized the abscess of it, then a fire came from the application; and then I walked around and did not know what God would do with that woman.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On the discharge of the umbilical cord when it becomes abscessed.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When the fever is high in the uvula, and it's swollen and long, it's called perpendicular; and if it's in the area of the throat and it's thick and round, then it's called bubo.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	More often when it's cured with what we've said in the division, and not conflicting with your cure, and especially if several times the aposteme is cauterized and it's subtle, then beware that you incise what is accumulated around; and if it's to that length, and it's bloody, of dark color or black, and not in its center, then beware that you touch the incision of it, for there is fear regarding the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see that according to the method that has been said about its whiteness and length, you should seize the patient and press their tongue with an instrument which processes its shape and return the nail to the new moon, and pull it down and incise it with one of two instruments which are mentioned in the incision of two molars.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And beware that you do not incise it except what is adjusted according to the natural term of its addition, for if you incise more of it, you will damage its speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the incision, using the same one that we have recommended in the incision of two sides, and cure that which is inside until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is frightened by the incision, it is good to use art in the cauterization so that fear is removed, and the handling of the cautery on them is not but with sharp water, and it is that you put the head of the patient in a high place, and then press the tongue of theirs with the instrument that we have mentioned, and then take from the water which we have spoken of in the chapter on cauterization, and soak this cloth vividly, and apply this not rough nor subtle, and fill the concavity of the instrument of which this is the form:
