If the fistula is of long and profound depth, and it is according to the rectitude, then you must insert in the wound as much as you can, and remove all the corrupted flesh; and administer hot poultices wrapped in sharp medicines, and introduce them into the cavity of the fistula, which you have comprehended with iron.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do so until some visible results are seen, so that the sharp medicine corrodes all that is rotten in the cavity of the fistula from corruption.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	And then restore it with ointments which generate healthy flesh, so that it may be healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by that, then you cauterize it according to what we have recommended.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	But if the cause of the fistula is a bone and you must certify that, then you inquire into it and treat it according to what we have recommended, if you do not prohibit any cause of a vein or of a nerve or of a main member, as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is exposed and there is corruption or blackness in it, then remove all the corrupted material; and treat that which remains with a remedy so that the flesh may be healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it does not heal and the arm remains as it was, then know that you have not achieved total eradication of the corruption; and therefore you uncover the area again with second intention and carefully make the reason for it and the purification of it with the last strong force, and then restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And so if it is healed, it is good; and if not, then know that the corruption is in the deep inner part of the body, which has not been reached, and therefore you must not apply any ointment but rather lay a plaster on it.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted bone is small, or it is possible to reach it, then you should reach it with subtle and suitable instruments.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, then carefully make the extraction of all those, and do not leave any of them in place due to lack of strength on your part.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	If you find any cause of humidity, and in their incision there is no fear or error, then cut those ligaments or flesh if they are here, and scrape the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	Moreover, if you have not prepared the hour for setting the bones of that part, then pause on the wound that you think will heal the wound, and leave it until it is around those bones of flesh and ligaments, and guard the wound so it does not become consolidated, and the section that you have made in your operation is constrained.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Having, if you suspect, pause on the cot (or affected area) submerged in a poultice of olive oil, or the cot submerged in Egyptian gum, or in a plaster of green wraps, because when those ligaments will heal, and the bones are separated from the abscess, and from that attraction is alleviated.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	Moreover, if it is a large bone like the bone of the leg or thigh or similar to those, and that which is corrupted from it is only the surface, then scrub that with resin only until such time as the blackness and corruption are removed, and then restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	Moreover, if that which is corrupted from it is a large part, and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it is a necessary cause to close that and to make an incision in the place where the corruption has pervaded, and then treat it until it is consolidated.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend to you that you have a helper at your side, who will place and apply an example and assistant on your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	There is a young man of about thirty years of age, to whom pain occurs in his thigh, and from the affected parts it seems that the matter of the body has entered where the matter is made to reach the thigh, and it is a matter of a large abscess, and not due to an external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And then the time is prolonged for this due to the error of doctors until the abscess has opened, and a gathering of pus and matter occurs, and its cure is delayed until the thigh becomes fistulated, and there are formed in the wound orifices which constantly discharged pus and humidity from the body.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And then a multitude of doctors treated him for about two years, and not with wisdom but in skill, until I was called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw the thigh of his and the matter that flowed from it through those orifices with great force; and already the body of that man was completely corrupted and the color of it was citrine.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then I inserted my probe into one of those orifices and passed the probe to the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And then carefully examine and probe all the openings and investigate those that penetrate to the entire limb.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And then I will cut and dissect above one of the openings that lead to where I discovered a part of the bone, and I found the corrupted one, which was rotten and corrupted and discolored; and a part of the limb was already corrupted where it had penetrated into the marrow.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then I will wash what was discovered and prepared from the exposed bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I will extract that which is not in the bone but the corruption, which I will cut away and wash, and I had already destroyed.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And then I will apply the restoration of the wound with medicine that consolidates for a long time, but it is not consolidated.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I will treat and uncover the bone again, based on the first discovery, and I found continuous corruption with the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I will wash away that which appears to be from the corruption, and then I will make holes for the cure of it and its restoration, but it is not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I will uncover it again and not cease to cut the small bone little by little, particularly, and make holes for its restoration, but it is not restored until I cut around an area of it, and that which I extracted from its marrow, and then I will restore it with medicines, and it is consolidated lightly and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And it is not necessary to repeat the operation on them except for the disposition of their frailty and due to the lack of tolerance of theirs and fear of theirs of death, because acidity occurs in them every hour due to an excess of evacuation without copious malady.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And therefore it is healthy for total healing, and there is nothing in place of hard flesh; and the disposition of theirs is done well in their body and their strength returns; and it is established in their dispositions and does not cause contrariness in walking nor harm in any cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	More often if there is a prominent bone in the body already wounded, then it is necessary that you cut that bone in this manner: and it is that you take a ligature and strengthen it at the extremity of that prominent bone, and command someone to stretch it in its; and take a ligature of coarse wool from the first ligature; and apply that ligature over the flesh that is next to the bone, and extend the extremity of it so that you attract the flesh to the parts next to it, and you uncover the flesh around the area where you want to make an incision so that the incision does not damage the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And put a splint or board next to the bone properly, because when you do this it is not forbidden that the saw does not cut the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And it is necessary that the closure be made on the corrupted spot little by little, because if it is in the cavity of the bone and does not appear in its appearance to feeling, force the closure with the other visible aid.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted and not prominent, one part continues with the other, and the corruption is in the middle or in a part of it, then you discover all the flesh of all parts; and place your hand under them, and make a closure on that first part where the corruption is, until the closure of the other part is continued.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And let the closure be according to the place of the corruption a little, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, cut out that corrupted joint, and close the bone where it is continued from the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not in reason but ingenuity.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the chest of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; however, it is necessary that you inquire into the corruption in whatever manner it appears to you, and that you open it, and mend it according to each disposition which is possible for you, and with great ingenuity be rectified by you, when it does not cause discomfort or injury.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And you should know that the incisors and the saws to cut these bones are chosen according to the situation of the bones, and their preparation, and their thickness, and their subtlety and greatness and smallness, and their hardness and rarity; so that it is necessary that you prepare all species of operation instruments convenient for that operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And you should know that this operation refers to your knowledge of the species of instrument which you have indicated; when you have great study and lengthy and conscious understanding of the manners of this art, and testimony of the manners of illnesses, because then you have for yourself the means to apply what is convenient for each illness with instruments.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And thus you will form at the end of this chapter the names of the instruments which you will pause with simples, and with which you will proceed to your prohibition, which you will experiment on the others.
Forma de serra:	Form of a saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Form of another saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Form of yet another saw:
Forma de autra serra gran:	Form of a large saw:
Forma de ray:	Form of a rasp:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this rasp be according to the form of the head of a starred nail, and its points be according to the form of the points of the anvil.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	It does not suit unless the ends of the joints are rubbed when they are corrupted, or is the mouth wide open.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Form of a large razor for others:
Forma de razori menor:	Form of a smaller razor:
Forma de razori lat:	Form of a broad or wide razor:
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	Form of a properly made saw: it is made with an arch-shaped iron edge and the sharpness of the iron, and the handle of the tool is decently made.
Forma de lu:	Shape of it or its shape/form:
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Shape of a razor in which there is a hollow:
Forma de razori autra subtil:	Shape of another subtle or fine razor:
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	Shape of another razor with a curved extremity:
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	Shape of a small scraper resembling a file:
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	Shape of a cutter with which the bones are cut:
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Shape of another smaller cutter:
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another cutter; this resembling a saw, and its extremity is like a saw, and it is used in many places for cutting the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of a saw that suits for sawing what is perforated by the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its extremity is triangular and with a pointed extremity.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	It is made from iron of India, and similarly it cures all the causes that we have spoken of regarding abrasions and incisions and wounds.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incisions of extremities and of the sawing of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities are weakened either by an intrinsic cause or by an extrinsic cause, and when you have treated that corruption with the cure of those medicines and the cure is not effective, sometimes the corruption worsens to the point where it must be cut off, then it is necessary to cut off that member in which the corruption has taken hold, so that the patient may escape from death or malignancy which is a greater defect of the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that which has befallen, is that the member becomes black until it seems to be burned by fire, or it becomes weak and the blackness spreads until the decay enters into that member and seizes the whole body; and then it is time to proceed with the cutting of that.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly if it is a cause of the corruption, a sting from some venomous things such as the scorpion's tail or of the viper or of the rue or of similar things.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or the sting is in the extremity of the said, then you cut off the said and do not give space to the corruption so that it may not spread to the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if you approach the hand, then you inspect that for rot of the forearm, and do not give space to the corruption until it takes hold in the forearm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if it swells, then inspect the arm up to the elbow at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption passes beyond and the swelling reaches the elbow, then in that case it is death for the patient; and to administer another cause or treatment at this point is a matter of quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, make for the foot when corruption swells the said part of the foot, then you inspect it up to one of the nails.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold in the sole of the foot, then you inspect the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	More, if it reaches inside the tooth, then you inspect the leg up to the joint of the tooth.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already spread over the tooth, then in him it is not a remedy but dismissal, and leave the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the method of inspecting the member or of cutting it is that you stretch the ligament in the affected area where you want to inspect, and stretch another ligament over the location; and extend the minister a ligament to the affected areas, and extend the ministeress another ligament on hers; and you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments with a spatula so that all the flesh may be discovered; and then it is inspected or cut.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary that a cloth be placed over the entire affected area so that nothing touches it, and that a warm poultice or plaster be applied to the wounded area.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if there is an excessive flow of blood when you operate, then cauterize the area carefully, or apply to it some powders that restrain the blood; and return to your treatment once the bleeding has stopped.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the wounded limb with a suitable bandage, and take care of it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recommend to you that which I have found to be beneficial for someone with pain in their foot, this accident which I and you have recommended, which is because the blood accumulates in the foot due to a condition that was caused by an inflammation of heat.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And this corruption occurs mainly in the right foot, until it reaches the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepares himself such that his doctor visits him to apply the treatment to the limb with the violence of what he suffers from pain and inflammation, and it happens that the foot reaches the joint, and thus heals.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	A long time passes before this corrupted disease appears in the right hand of the affected person.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And thus I come to myself, and I have thoroughly considered the removal of that excess which is placed on the hand of medical treatments, according to the purification of the body of the patient; and if the excess does not recede, then begin to anoint the other said interior with which begins in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And the patient's hand made me understand, and I did not want to do that which is expected regarding the removal of that excess, and more than I feared the incision of the patient's hand, because the virtue of the sickness was in a precarious state.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he has departed from me, he returned to his own land and it came back to me that that man prepared and incised his whole hand, and he was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not added this narration except to be an aid regarding that which is caused by this sickness, and that it be a signification for what is signified and according to which it is worked.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the cure of sins and the quality of purging with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When abscesses occur in certain fleshy members and the space of the abscess is prolonged until it makes a collection of blood, and then it is broken and perforated, and the blood comes out, and the place is left empty as if it were a vessel, and the cloth that is put on it is like a delicate drap, and it does not allow dirt to accumulate, and it does not press on the bone or nerve or ligament, it is called a sinus, and it is not named fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	Worse will be if the space is prolonged until the corruption affects some member, then it is called fistula and not gout.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure for it is that you cut out the entire cord thus as it is turned, and mainly when it is subtly made with a cloth, and constrictions that do not adhere to the place because of its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	Worse if you hope that the cord adheres and that the corruption has not been achieved by consecutive treatment, and in the cord there has been a passage of stool, then your cure is to give an enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And it is that you consider the sinus, and if it is large, and the arm that you make is of foul-smelling dung, then clisterize with this medication from Egypt, which is made of oil and bitter vinegar and juniper, received in small portions, and adjusted in a vessel, and put on the fire until the medication becomes liquid and penetrates to the species of honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then take the liquid that is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; and clisterize it into the sinus, and strengthen the opening of it, and let the medicine stay in it for the quantity of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then extract that with precision; and do so for as many days as needed until the sinus is cleaned and the pus is removed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes it is cleansed with water of cinder, when this medication is not present to you; and it is that you take the cinder of wine, and mix it with water; and then glue that and cleanse him with it until you confirm that the sinus, then, is closed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient has no tolerance for the Egyptian medication or the water of cinder, then cleanse him with water and honey which has been mixed with ground ginger, and cleanse him with wine and honey mixed, because the property of honey is that it cleans and washes, and the wine makes the sinus adhere, and especially when the wine has an excess of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you do this sometimes and confirm that the sinus is already cleaned, then cleanse him with water that makes the flesh grow in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And it is that you take the plaster of dyaphonicum and dissolve it with rose oil and astringent wine; or that you cleanse him with some medications and other plasters which have properties that I have already written in the treatise on plasters.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifice of the sinus is too narrow for the reception of the cannula of the clyster, then you will enlarge it little by little with a small iron tool, and place it in a warm wrap soaked in Egyptian or basilicum ointment until it becomes enlarged.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly if the orifice is large, then you will sew the lips of it with a suture and adjust the quantity in which the clyster enters.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice of that from which the arm protrudes is elevated to the upper parts, then dry that in the lowest place where it is in you through which the arm runs, for when the arm is constricted in the profundity of the sinus the flesh will be engendered there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinus through the lowest bone according to your will, then prepare the member with preparation so that the arm can run freely as it should be, and that nothing should be retained that could cause retention of the arm.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidative medicines that are applied to the sinus, conveniently adapted to what you want to extract those on a cloth of linen.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth should be of as great a quantity as is necessary for the communication with the entire sinus; and then insert in the right place of the orifice of the sinus a tube slightly larger than the orifice of the sinus; and then spread on another cloth of linen ointments of lion according to the quantity of the tube, and apply it on that place for a long time on the orifice of the sinus so that the heaviness of the arm is alleviated and the cloth does not obstruct, but rather anoints the diseased area one time.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	More of that which is above the orifice of the sinus, which you massage at all times so that it comes to be adjusted in the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And to know if that which runs from the arm is movement or little, or is digestion, or is not-digestion.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And also you consider the place of that sinus, if in it the patient feels pain or not, and if it is an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your medication is prolonged in such a manner, and you see the material that is applied to the orifice of the sinus already adhering, or its own adherence, then you might apply it on the third day, and when you apply the plaster, then change the dressing for another and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if from the sinus its own space emits subtle mucus, then do not despair of its adherence, for the healing of it is proper, for thus it closes wounds in which slow generation of flesh in the aforementioned plagues occurs, and of those in which the opposite of it is made.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if from the sinus for many days there is discharge of undigested arm, then know that the sinus does not adhere; and if the adherence of the sinus is delayed and its cause prolonged, then you adjust in drying of the medications, and if the medications are humid in their substance and in their virtue, they are dried thus as an ointment of diafinicon, when there is adjusted superflluity of addition of discharge.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the more immediate remedy by which it is cured, is that one takes ointment of diafinicon and dissolves it in heated oil, and applies it to the affected area with an old cloth in its substance, and wraps it around the patient, and uses that.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And it seems similar in that action, when there is no arm, ointment of diafinicon, as much as it is cooked until it becomes thick, and uses it; or one takes myrrh and wool and ashes, and grinds everything and powders it over the honey which is on the fire, and wraps that in a cloth and tightens it around the sinus; and wraps that with the honey which you have cooked until it becomes thick, and powders it on a cloth and tightens it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And some remedies are administered to the patient with aristology, long roots and celestial lily (which is celestial lily) and flour of dragons and centaury, and uses those simples or adjusts, grinds those and sifts and powders them over the honey which has been recommended; and gives it to him.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinus is prolonged, and it is not healed by this cure, then you know that the corruption is in the patient's chest, and it makes an inquiry in the bones or in the other hard members or in the ligaments; then you treat it with a fistular cure, as it is said previously.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the treatment of afflicted nails and injured fingers and the cutting of added toes and the division of.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	A panarici is an abscess which forms on the nail of the thumb or big toe of the hand or foot, and also appears on other toes, and as it progresses its treatment is highly prized, or it is cauterized with a hot iron, or it becomes corrupted, and it causes the root of the nail to rot, and soon corrupts the entire nail, and soon exposes its corruption to the bone which has a foul odor, and the extremity of the affected part becomes black, and its color turns dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And then when you have that on the hand as we have said in the division and you don't confuse your treatment, then it is good that you cut away all the excess that remains of the nail and then cauterize the wound immediately, for a hot cauterization is beneficial in this case.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the additions of the nail have already begun to grip the flesh at the roots, and start to pierce it and cause pain, then it is good that you apply a subtle remedy beneath the angle of the nail that pierces the flesh, and press it gently upwards and cut away the flesh with ease, and apply on top of that what remains of the flesh the corrosive medicines that will consume all the bad parts; and then treat that area with ointments until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	If the corruption has already penetrated the bone, then it is necessary that you incise the bone and extract it, for no time is healthy when the corrupted bone is in the body.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the decay and corruption have reached the finger, then incise it on one of the nodes according to where the memory of the pain is pressed, and carefully treat it until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	If the nail has received a blow or an injury, and there is violent pain in it, then it is necessary that you begin by bloodletting the patient, and immediately cut the nail with a sharp spatula, cutting transversely from below to above, and be careful that the cut does not penetrate the flesh that is beneath the nail, because you would cause the patient violent pain, and it would be a cause for the generation of excess flesh in the area; and treat that place with what relieves the pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But a well-adjusted finger, which is born in the hands of some men, is strong in all its flesh, and strong in its bones, or strong in its nails.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born from the root of the joint, or it is the generation of them in certain nodes of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	Worse is he who is born with pain in his joints, and this one who is born with strong joints is not injured.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And of those who are born fleshy, the section is lighter, and it is that you should insert the root with a spatula blade.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	Worse for he who is born in the root of the joint, the cure is difficult; and therefore beware of the abscession of it.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Worse in he who is born with fingers of the toes, it is that you should insert at the beginning the flesh of it with rounded incision into the bone, and then cut with one of those convenient scissors to this, and then cure what will be healthy inside.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	Worse consolidation which occurs to the fingers between their worn-out joints or by birth of the man who is born thus, or by consolidation of a wound or by combustion of fire, or by resemblance, therefore it is that you should cut that consolidation so that the fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And then pause between the clothes of the swollen feet with oil rubbed so that they are not consolidated lightly, and separate between them, or put between them a thin layer of lead so that it is consolidated as it is fitting.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly if consolidation occurs in some of the palm's digits, then you should dry that consolidation according to how it is prepared and adapted to the shape of the limb.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of incision of veins, these are varices.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Veins are varices, and they are enlarged veins filled with melancholic superfluities which appear in the form of swelling on the limbs of the body, and the main occurrence of them is in the thighs, especially in the thighs of travelers and laborers and carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore, we advise that you administer a purge of the body for black bile several times with strong expulsion, and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The cure of them with iron is according to two methods: one is that the vein should be incised and the black blood drawn out, and the other method is that the vein should be elevated and all of it extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The sectioning of it is according to this method: at the beginning, immerse the thigh in hot water until the gross blood is dissolved, which purges the thigh, and then tightly bind the patient's thigh to the upper part of the hip with a bandage, and then cut the vein in one place, or two, or three with a wide incision, and then elevate the black blood with the hand that holds the lower part of the thigh inside it, and from inside to outside, until there comes out the quantity of blood that you want and that is sufficient, and which the virtue of the patient can tolerate.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then treat that area, and order them to abstain from foods that cause black bile to form.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And the cure is achieved by phlebotomy when the veins are filled and this brings no relief to the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	More elevation is achieved in this manner: you raise the patient's leg, if it is mobile, and then put it in a bath and immerse the leg in hot water until it becomes red and the veins are full; or it can be exercised by strong movement, if a bath is not available, until the member is warmed.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then sear the vein in the right area by section in the length or in the back of the arm near the elbow, or in the lowest part of the arm near the heel.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then uncover the vein with a knife and scrape the vein from every part until it becomes apparent to feeling, and it is near the appearance of what seems to be a blackish cord declining to darkness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And then as you evacuate and from the vein you see that white thing which seems to be a cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then you put the patient's arm in a sling until it is elevated and removed from the vein, and suspend it with a bandage or a linen cloth.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then cut the other section and then cut that section for three days, and then scratch the skin of the affected part above the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then lift that and insert it into the last section of the heel, and then pull it out and lift it until it is extracted through the second section, and then pull it from the section that is above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this until you extract it from the section that is most superficial or highest of all the sections, until everything is extracted; then insert it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if it does not obey your attempt to extract and lift, then insert a strong double-threaded needle and tie it and pull it out, or insert the instrument beside the vein and turn your hand in every direction until it is discharged.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And beware that it is not inserted; for if it is broken, it will be difficult for you to lift the dead flesh and it will come upon the patient for that nuisance.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat. And if the vita is contracted having twisted the part which is enveloped by the partitions, and it's not according to rectitude as we have said, then it is necessary that you make a ligature on that entire affected part of the twisting of it and on the areas of its enveloping, and place your suspensor above it with an unguent that elevates it.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And beware that you do not cut the vein and that you do not harm it, because it will be difficult for you to elevate it; and preserve your discretion in this.

Forma de unci orp:	Figure of a single hernia (or perhaps "figure of a navel" or

It is not to the hernia that is accustomed thus as with the intestines nor is it of sharp extremity so that it does not harm the vein; and it is of thick flexibility, because if it were subtle, it would cut the vein due to its subtlety; but it has in it a superfluous thickness thus as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of the extraction of the vein of the leg.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in cold and damp lands, just like in the land of Arabs and in the dry and arid lands of little tenderness, and in which there is neither grass nor tree.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And for this reason it is generated in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And the gestation of it is from putrefaction that comes from the decomposition of the body, as when worms and snakes and lice and worms are generated between the rot and the flesh.

And if the movement is prolonged, then you cut a piece of it and wrap the remainder; do not cut that from the root until it is completely removed, because if you cut it, it becomes contracted and enters into the flesh and causes an abscess and pus to form in the area and bad ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	So that it may be treated gently and extracted little by little, until it is removed from the back of the patient and no remainder of it stays in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein there comes out in some men what is in its length of 5 palms and thickness, and it has already seemed to me that one comes out of 20 palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it happens at the time of its medication, then introduce the needle into the hole of the patient and puncture that long channel in the body, until everything that is in the matter is evacuated, and apply putrefaction to the area for several days with medicines; and then treat that place for the cure of abscesses.
