And then place the edge of the table on the spine, and the doctor places his feet on the other extremity, and stretch tightly until the spine is constricted and returns to its place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you want, take the turn which is turned around with the hand; and it is that you fix on the ground at the back of the patient two feet, the length of which is one arm, and fix the other end of it also two feet; and let the length between each foot be a palm, and already made in each foot a hole through which the turn turns, and each one is held firmly on the ground so that it does not move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And let there be a wooden pole in which the turn is made, and let it be wrapped around the two trunks of the two poles.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the extremity of it is a trunk in which the pole is formed, the length of which is one palm and that which is wrapped around; and on the other two poles is similar to that one.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then tighten the ligaments that you have tied on the chest of the patient in the pole which is near the head of it, and the ligaments that you have tied on the thighs of it in the turn which is near the feet of it.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then behind each turn there should be a servant who will turn it with their hand, and the doctor will anoint the spine as we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the shape of the turn:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And then after the spine is returned and the area is anointed, then take a plaster made with egg albumen, and apply it; and put it on the plaster of the table from which the width is three fingers or about that, and the length of it is the quantity that takes the place of the swelling, and on the part of the spine above.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then let it be tied with a ligament as we have said, and give the patient subtle nourishment so that they may be healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there is some remaining weakness in the area at the end of the treatment, then it is customary that medicines which soften and loosen be administered for a long time, which we have recommended; and already administered in that place a plaster of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And some times accidents occur in the dislocation of the vertebrae of the back, and it is suspected that it is due to that dislocation; and it is that bone which has already been weakened so that it is not advisable to administer this medicine to him, for it will bring about a rapid death.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the treatment of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	It is known that the joint of the hip and the joint of the muscle do not only cause dislocation, but also do not occur with the same small movement and cavity that occurs in the other joints.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the hip is dislocated in four ways, for it can be dislocated upwards, or downwards, or forwards, or backwards.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And mostly it is dislocated upwards, and rarely forwards or backwards.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of dislocation upwards is that, when you adjust the leg of the healthy side to the sick side, it appears longer and the knee is more prominent than the healthy one, and the sick leg cannot bend towards the thigh, and it is the place where the thigh is separated by a swelling of hot cauterization, so that the head of the hip has already come out.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	In the case of the person in whom dislocation occurs at the joints, it is that the accidents of this are contrary to this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	In the case of the person in whom dislocation occurs at the teeth, it is because the leg or thigh is expanded according to its complement, but it does not double that pain which is in the tooth, and if it perforates to go and cannot above that to the teeth; and the urine of him is retained and his anus is swollen, and you must watch the walking of him on the sole.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	In the case of the person in whom dislocation occurs at the back, it is that he does not expand the tooth, nor can he double that which doubles his anus, and the leg of him is thus shorter than the other, and the anus is softened, and the head of the thigh is in that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	But reduction of the species of this dislocation is what you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and ancient, that it has already become accustomed to having it, you administer reduction to it and ointment according to its disposition, then it is not entirely in this cure; and therefore it is not suitable that a prognosis be made in this case.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	In that case where the dislocation is recent, and it is one of the four species of dislocation, then you should reduce it by returning the joint to its proper place and extending it to the inner and outer parts, and moving it to the right and left, for it will strongly return and not require another cure.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return in this manner, then you should prepare a strong minister who extends the patient's leg from the affected part, or with their hands, or with a bandage that is tied over the patient's knee; and another minister should extend the hand of the one behind to place their hands under the patient's buttocks; and you should hold the linen binding firmly over the knee, and have another minister hold the extremity of the binding.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And it should be extended from the inner part or from the front to the back of the hip, or from the back to the buttocks.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And the extension of all those things should be in a way that the patient is raised from the ground and remains hanging.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this type of extension is common to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And so if the dislocation returns to what we have said, it will be good; and if not, then it is necessary to apply the specific treatment that I will speak of regarding its own cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of the displaced joint, when it is dislocated and the dislocation is in the inner parts, make sure that the patient is placed on their back; and place a pause to the ligaments at the base of the thigh in the location where between the head of the thigh and the spot where the hamstring is found; and then stretch the ligament upwards from the part of the hip to the uppermost part of the buttock.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then another strong minister should take the patient's arms, and press the thick part of the thigh, and stretch it to the rear parts with violent extension, so that it returns to its own place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this species is of the easiest cure among those in which this member is reduced, more so than the other species.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if you are excused from this and do not obey the treatment with this species of cure at all, then it is necessary that both feet of the patient be tied together with a strong ligament, lightly, on both ankles and both toes.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And let the length of each one be four fingers, and the patient's leg be extended more than the other by two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And then let the patient be suspended from the top of the beam, and it should be on a mattress; and the length from the ground should be two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And then command a strong youth to gently press the head of the thigh, and let another youth be suspended with the patient, and the other youth pressing the thigh strongly from below, so that the joint returns to its place with speed.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	More in the proper reduction, when there is dislocation to the outward part, it is good that the patient puts on a poultice as we have recommended in having coldness; and let the ligament be strengthened over the sick thigh properly and over their chest.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And then let two cloths be placed, one at their feet, and the other at the head; and let adjusted cloths be placed in the middle of the poultice made on which humid draps are wrapped, so that the patient is not damaged by what the cloth is between their thighs, because the extension to the outward parts should not be attracted.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And then let each minister extend to their part, and the doctor with their hand guide the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if it obeys to the treatment, it will be good greatly; and if not, place on that diligently and do as we have said in coldness for that wrapping.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	More cover that which the patient has on the sides of their bed a sheet.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in the front parts, then cover so that the leg is gently extended, and it is according to this medical narration on pus; and the doctor puts the palm of their right hand on the patient's languor, and returns the heart to the other hand, and with that tightening stops the extension of the front parts and the part of the teeth.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is in the back parts, then do not cover so that the patient's leg is extended to the back parts, and it is raised from the ground; instead, cover that it is placed on a hard surface, just as we would do if their hip is dislocated to the front parts, according to what we have said about placing them on two hips; and it is on their face and the ligaments are extended, as we have said, there is no error.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And cover that compression be administered with a board on the place where the joint is.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Then, as the reduction is completed as it should be — and the sign of the reduction is not hidden from you, and that is you extend the patient's two legs, and when you see those groins and the patient stretches their leg and expands its six articulations, then you know that the member is returned as it should be — and then you adjust the two hips and put a plaster cast and stretch with a bandage so that the hip is not displaced in any of the parts; and keep the patient at rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	Then return the ligament and the plaster, and compare one leg with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	When, if you see those swellings in the garment, then you know that the dislocation has already been treated, and therefore let the patient go to the bathroom.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of softening, then you return and plaster it, and stretch it according to your first instruction, and let it be for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	Then undo that, and make him delay walking on crutches for some days, until he is comforted.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter thirty-two.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the treatment of dislocation of the ankle.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The ankle is dislocated in three ways, for it is dislocated forward, and backward, and to the sides more than the front parts; and the front parts are not dislocated.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of its dislocation is that it commands the patient to put their leg on their thigh; then you know that the ankle is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all its ways is that you make the patient do this: lift their leg up, so that they extend their leg if possible; place their two hands on their face; and hold their foot between your two feet; then make the ankle adhere to your palms, and press those together over the ankle with force, and another servant lifts their foot until the ankle returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	The sign of recovery in him is that his leg adheres to the thigh with a light non-working movement.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then apply a plaster to that and make the leg adhere to the thigh, and then bind those together with a bandage for three days or four, and then remove it.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not allow the patient to walk for several days, until he is healed and comforted.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	More so if the reduction of it to you is excessive, then administer a strong extension with ligaments which in the cure of the hip the preceding narration has described.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the cure of the dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle sometimes is injured by slight movement, and sometimes it is dislocated according to the injury, and the dislocation of it is caused either by internal or external parts.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of its dislocation is that the ankle is swollen due to the part to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the cure of its sprain is from gentle reduction, and it is that it should be extended with ease and held steady until it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in the cure of it when it is dislocated according to the injury, it is necessary that you make the patient straight, and have a strong and powerful servant behind them in the middle of their back.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then put your right hand on the upper part of the foot and your left hand on the lower part of the foot in the area of the calf.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then pull the foot towards your right hand, and with your left hand hold for two fingers, and stretch with your left hand; and press the chest of the foot with your right hand above the leg to relieve the effort.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do this twice according to what we have recounted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then press the chest of the foot on the leg for the third time, and you are at the calf.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Therefore, if it returns in one or two times according to this method, and if the foot is restored to health, it's good; and if not, then repeat the operation, because that will restore it.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if the reduction of the limb is prohibited to you that we have recommended, then make the patient lie on their back on the ground, and stretch a piece of cloth firmly on the ground, and let it catch between their thighs, and you have enveloped them in a sheet so that the disease does not escape.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And then one minister holds their thighs, and another minister stretches the foot with their hands or with a bandage that lies on the ankle of the foot; and then each minister stretches against the extension of their partner, and the cloth is stretched between the patient's thighs, retaining it, so that the body of the patient is not pulled towards the lower parts above their extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And then the doctor should adjust the dislocation with his hands, and another assistant should hold the healthy thigh to the patient's sides, so that the dislocation returns to its proper place.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And so when the dislocation returns and it is declared to you the health of the reduction of it, then apply a plaster and extract that with a strong bandage, and tie the foot to the leg with a bandage.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And beware that you protect the nerves which are located behind the ankle, so that the bandage on that area is not violent and tight, so as to constrict it strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And then leave it like that for two days or for three; and if the bandage is loosened, tighten it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And then undo it on the third day or on the fourth, and prohibit the patient from moving for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if it is forgotten to remove the dressing from that place, it is not done safely that the dislocation is not dissolved and corrupted on it, and then that which does not receive treatment.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if a hot abscess occurs to it, then beware that you administer in the evacuation of it that which we previously mentioned, in another place of treatment and of application, until it is reduced.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter four.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the treatment of dislocation of the toes of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	It is advisable that one who is dislocated should be treated with a gentle extension of the limb; and this is not difficult, but rather easy.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in one of the toes of the foot, then it is advisable to make the patient place their foot on the ground or on a table, and let them stand like that as if they were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then put your foot on theirs, and press their foot on what seems to be the joint, and press down with your foot in an upright manner until it returns, and you will see that it has been properly treated and does not appear out of place.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then put a table under the belly of their foot that holds the entire foot, which has two ends, and tie it with a decent and firm structure for three days; and then undo it and make them rest from walking for many days, until it is strengthened and the recovery is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter thirty-five.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	On the types of dislocations that are made with a wound or with a fracture or with several things at the same time.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When accidents occur due to certain causes, and you are piercing through the treatment of that and in the restoration of it, many seen successes lead to death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And for this it is not suitable that anyone presumes over the treatment of it, except one who is wise in the art, with long usage, merciful and pitied, slow, not hasty nor presumptuous; and who uses in the commencement of medicines that cause abscesses to be cut out only, and lift the patient to divine judgment, but rather to the one to whom you expect salvation from loss, and from the sickness alleviation, and in which appears some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then strive to remove yourself so far from it the reduction in the commencement of the cause, waiting for an abscess to be cut out.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the member returns as we wish, then administer treatment which will cut out the abscess and cure the wound with what is convenient for it from the ointments of the dried placents.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if there is a dislocation with a fracture and it occurs in the bones that are separated by joints, then you will pierce through their articulation, and do in this what we have said about simple illnesses of this type that precede in the locations of these.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And beware and avoid according to your ability the one who is in the intestines of fear, as my preaching has preceded you; for that which is better for you, you owe to your Creator, and more permanent to your glory, and more salutations to your body, verify those in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus the words of Albucasim are perfected by the means of which God is blessed.
